info.name: Ripple 2018 - Minimal provision
info.description: Pefroms minimum required to create EHR, upload a set of Ripple templates and associated test data.

request.description:
Logs in the specified user, creating a new session in the process.

* If successful, adds the Session token to the Postman environment, which will be used by subsequent Ehrscape calls

A successful call will create a new OpenEHR session for the specified user. The session ID will be returned both as a JSON response to this call, as well as in the Ehr-Session HTTP response header.

In order to ensure that this newly created session is used on subsequent REST requests, the client needs to make the calls with the HTTP request header Ehr-Session value set to the session ID.

Example of a successful call response:

```{
  "action": "CREATE",
  "sessionId": "096c9d95-c434-4c97-a7ee-59e2c521ec33"
}
The response header, with the Ehr-Session set, will look like this:

{
  "Server": "Jetty(9.1.1.v20140108)",
  "Transfer-Encoding": "chunked",
  "Content-Language": "en-US",
  "Content-Type": "application/json;charset=UTF-8",
  "Access-Control-Allow-Origin": "http://localhost:8082",
  "Access-Control-Expose-Headers": "",
  "Access-Control-Allow-Credentials": "true",
  "Ehr-Session": "096c9d95-c434-4c97-a7ee-59e2c521ec33"
}```

item.name: Create new EHR, linked to subjectId

request.description:
Creates a new EHR and returns its ID.

The `ehrID` environment variable is updated after this call.

The call will fail with Error 400 if the ehr already exists for this subjectId/namespace.

The caller can specify an external subject ID and subject namespace to whom the new EHR will belong.

An example of a successful response body:

``
{
  "meta": {
    "href": "http://localhost:8082/rest/v1/ehr/f77f9b4a-cfda-414d-aa6c-4f78bcac7601"  
  },
  "action": "CREATE",  
  "ehrId": "f77f9b4a-cfda-414d-aa6c-4f78bcac7601"  
}
``

                    <archetype_id>
                      <value>openEHR-EHR-CLUSTER.problem_status.v0</value>
                    </archetype_id>
                    <term_definitions code="at0000">
                      <items id="description">Qualifiers for a specified problem or diagnosis.</items>
                      <items id="text">Problem/Diagnosis status</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0001">
                      <items id="comment">This data element is usually recorded as part of a clinical consultation.</items>
                      <items id="description">Category  new, recurring and ongoing issues, problems or diagnoses.</items>
                      <items id="text">Episodicity</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0003">
                      <items id="description">Category that supports division of problems and diagnoses into Active or Inactive problem lists.</items>
                      <items id="text">Active/Inactive?</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0004">
                      <items id="comment">The status is usually determined by a combination of the timing of diagnosis plus level of clinical certainty resulting from diagnostic tests and clinical evidence available. Terms are aligned with SNOMED CT.</items>
                      <items id="description">Stage or phase of diagnostic process.</items>
                      <items id="text">Diagnostic status</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0016">
                      <items id="description">The initial diagnosis made, usually associated with a low level of clinical certainty. It may change as test results or advice become available.</items>
                      <items id="text">Preliminary</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0017">
                      <items id="description">Interim diagnosis, based on a reasonable amount of clinical certainty but pending further test results or clinical advice. It may still change as test results or advice become available.</items>
                      <items id="text">Working</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0018">
                      <items id="description">Final substantiated diagnosis, based on a high level of clinical certainty, which includes clinical evidence from test results. It is not expected to change.</items>
                      <items id="text">Established</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0026">
                      <items id="description">The problem or diagnosis is currently active and clinically relevant.</items>
                      <items id="text">Active</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0027">
                      <items id="description">The problem or diagnosis is not completely resolved but is inactive or felt less relevant to the current clinical context.</items>
                      <items id="text">Inactive</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0034">
                      <items id="description">A new occurrence of either a new or existing problem or diagnosis. A flag for 'First occurrence' can be recorded separately to distinguish the first from other occurrences.</items>
                      <items id="text">New episode</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0035">
                      <items id="description">The issue, problem or diagnosis continues, without occurrences of new episodes.</items>
                      <items id="text">Ongoing episode</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0060">
                      <items id="comment">Aligned with SNOMEDCT.</items>
                      <items id="description">Category that supports division of problems and diagnoses into Current or Past problem lists.</items>
                      <items id="text">Current/Past?</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0061">
                      <items id="description">An issue occuring in the past.</items>
                      <items id="text">Past</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0062">
                      <items id="description">An issue which ocurred at present.</items>
                      <items id="text">Current</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0063">
                      <items id="description">In episodic care contexts (commonly  secondary care) it is common to categorise/ organise problems according to their relationship to the principal problem or diagnosis being addressed during that episode of care. These categories may also be used for clinical coding, reporting and billing purposes.</items>
                      <items id="text">DRG category</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0064">
                      <items id="description">The diagnosis determined to be chiefly responsible for occasionaing an episode of admitted patient care, an episode of residential care or an attendance at the health care establishment.</items>
                      <items id="text">Principal diagnosis</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0066">
                      <items id="description">A problem or diagnosis that is occurs at the same time as the primary problem or diagnosis. May also be known as a comorbid condition.</items>
                      <items id="text">Secondary diagnosis</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0070">
                      <items id="description">It is not possible to determine if this occurrence of the problem or diagnosis is new or ongoing.</items>
                      <items id="text">Indeterminate</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0071">
                      <items id="comment">Record as True if this is the first ever occurrence of this problem or diagnosis. This data element can be an additional qualifier on the 'New episode' value in the 'Episodicity' value set, that is a condition such as asthma can have recurring new episodes that have periods of resolution in between. However it can be important to identify the first every episode of asthma from all of the other episodes.</items>
                      <items id="description">Is this the first ever occurrence of this problem or diagnosis?</items>
                      <items id="text">First occurrence?</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0073">
                      <items id="comment">Record as True if the problem or diagnosis was present on admission. This data element enables identification of complications or secondary diagnoses that commenced during a specified admission for DRG reporting purposes.</items>
                      <items id="description">Was the problem or diagnosis present at admission?</items>
                      <items id="text">Present on admission?</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0076">
                      <items id="description">An unfavorable evolution of a problem or diagnosis.</items>
                      <items id="text">Complication</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0077">
                      <items id="description">The pattern or evolution of the problem or diagnosis.</items>
                      <items id="text">Course</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0078">
                      <items id="description">A recurring problem or diagnosis, with periods of resolution in between episodes or occurrences.</items>
                      <items id="text">Relapsing</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0079">
                      <items id="description">A problem or diagnosis with persistent or long-lasting effects, or that evolves over time.</items>
                      <items id="text">Chronic</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0081">
                      <items id="description">A problem or diagnosis with a rapid onset, a short course, or both.</items>
                      <items id="text">Acute</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0082">
                      <items id="comment">For example: The boolean data type could be used to signify that the problem/diagnosis can be included in a patient summary; the text data type could be used to categorise in a similar way to 'Current?' or Active?'; and the count data type could be used to assert a priority key or order to problems and diagnoses in a list. If any uses are identified as frequently required, they could be added explicitly to this archetype as an explicit data element.</items>
                      <items id="description">Unspecified qualifier that will be renamed, data type selected and potential value sets specified in a template.</items>
                      <items id="text">Unspecified</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0083">
                      <items id="description">Status of resolution or healing of an acute problem or diagnosis.</items>
                      <items id="text">Resolution status</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0084">
                      <items id="description">Problem or diagnosis has completed the normal phases of restoration or healing and can be considered resolved.</items>
                      <items id="text">Resolved</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0085">
                      <items id="description">Problem or diagnosis is progressing satisfactorily through the normal stages of restoration or healing towards resolution.</items>
                      <items id="text">Resolving</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0086">
                      <items id="description">Problem or diagnosis is not progressing satisfactorily through the normal stages of restoration or healing towards resolution.</items>
                      <items id="text">Not resolving</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0087">
                      <items id="description">It is not possible to determine the resolution or healing status of the problem or diagnosis.</items>
                      <items id="text">Indeterminate</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0088">
                      <items id="description">The diagnosis has been clinically reassessed or has been disproved with a high level of clinical certainty.</items>
                      <items id="text">Refuted</items>
                    </term_definitions>

            <archetype_id>
              <value>openEHR-EHR-EVALUATION.problem_diagnosis.v1</value>
            </archetype_id>
            <term_definitions code="at0000">
              <items id="comment">Clear delineation between the scope of a problem versus a diagnosis is not easy to achieve in practice. For the purposes of clinical documentation with this archetype, problem and diagnosis are regarded as a continuum, with increasing levels of detail and supportive evidence usually providing weight towards the label of 'diagnosis'.</items>
              <items id="description">Details about a single identified health condition, injury, disability or any other issue which impacts on the physical, mental and/or social well-being of an individual.</items>
              <items id="text">Problem/Diagnosis</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0001">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">structure</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0002">
              <items id="comment">Coding of the name of the problem or diagnosis with a terminology is preferred, where possible.</items>
              <items id="description">Identification of the problem or diagnosis, by name.</items>
              <items id="text">Problem/Diagnosis name</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0003">
              <items id="comment">Partial dates are acceptable. If the subject of care is under the age of one year, then the complete date or a minimum of the month and year is necessary to enable accurate age calculations - for example, if used to drive decision support. Data captured/imported as "Age at time of clinical recognition" should be converted to a date using the subject's date of birth.</items>
              <items id="description">Estimated or actual date/time the diagnosis or problem was recognised by a healthcare professional.</items>
              <items id="text">Date/time clinically recognised</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0005">
              <items id="comment">If severity is included in the Problem/diagnosis name via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant. Note: more specific grading of severity can be recorded using the Specific details SLOT.</items>
              <items id="description">An assessment of the overall severity of the problem or diagnosis.</items>
              <items id="text">Severity</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0009">
              <items id="comment">Use to provide background and context, including evolution, episodes or exacerbations, progress and any other relevant details, about the problem or diagnosis.</items>
              <items id="description">Narrative description about the problem or diagnosis.</items>
              <items id="text">Clinical description</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0012">
              <items id="comment">Coding of the name of the anatomical location with a terminology is preferred, where possible.
Use this data element to record precoordinated anatomical locations. If the requirements for recording the anatomical location are determined at run-time by the application or require more complex modelling such as relative locations then use the CLUSTER.anatomical_location or CLUSTER.relative_location within the 'Structured anatomical location' SLOT in this archetype. Occurrences for this data element are unbounded to allow for clinical scenarios such as describing a rash in multiple locations but where all of the other attributes are identical. If the anatomical location is included in the Problem/diagnosis name via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant. 

</items>
              <items id="description">Identification of a simple body site for the location of the problem or diagnosis.</items>
              <items id="text">Body site</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0030">
              <items id="comment">Partial dates are acceptable. If the subject of care is under the age of one year, then the complete date or a minimum of the month and year is necessary to enable accurate age calculations - for example, if used to drive decision support. Data captured/imported as "Age at time of resolution" should be converted to a date using the subject's date of birth.
</items>
              <items id="description">Estimated or actual date/time of resolution or remission for this problem or diagnosis, as determined by a healthcare professional.</items>
              <items id="text">Date/time of resolution</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0032">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">Tree</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0039">
              <items id="comment">Use this SLOT to insert the CLUSTER.anatomical_location or CLUSTER.relative_location archetypes if the requirements for recording the anatomical location are determined at run-time by the application or require more complex modelling such as relative locations.

If the anatomical location is included in the Problem/diagnosis name via precoordinated codes, use of this SLOT becomes redundant.

</items>
              <items id="description">A structured anatomical location for the problem or diagnosis.</items>
              <items id="text">Structured body site</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0043">
              <items id="comment">May include structured detail about the grading or staging of the diagnosis; diagnostic criteria, classification criteria or formal severity assessments such as Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events.</items>
              <items id="description">Details that are additionally required to record as unique attributes of this problem or diagnosis.</items>
              <items id="text">Specific details</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0046">
              <items id="comment">Use status or context qualifiers with care, as they are variably used in practice and interoperability cannot be assured unless usage is clearly defined with the community of use. For example: active status - active, inactive, resolved, in remission; evolution status - initial, interim/working, final; temporal status - current, past; episodicity status - first, new, ongoing; admission status - admission, discharge; or priority status - primary, secondary.</items>
              <items id="description">Structured details for location-, domain-, episode- or workflow-specific aspects of the diagnostic process.</items>
              <items id="text">Status</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0047">
              <items id="description">The problem or diagnosis does not interfere with normal activity or may cause damage to health if left untreated.</items>
              <items id="text">Mild</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0048">
              <items id="description">The problem or diagnosis causes interference with normal activity or will damage health if left untreated.</items>
              <items id="text">Moderate</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0049">
              <items id="description">The problem or diagnosis prevents normal activity or will seriously damage health if left untreated.</items>
              <items id="text">Severe</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0069">
              <items id="description">Additional narrative about the problem or diagnosis not captured in other fields.</items>
              <items id="text">Comment</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0070">
              <items id="description">The date this problem or diagnosis was last updated.</items>
              <items id="text">Last updated</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0071">
              <items id="comment">For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.</items>
              <items id="description">Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.</items>
              <items id="text">Extension</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0072">
              <items id="description">Narrative description about the course of the problem or diagnosis since onset.</items>
              <items id="text">Course description</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0073">
              <items id="description">The level of confidence in the identification of the diagnosis.</items>
              <items id="text">Diagnostic certainty</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0074">
              <items id="description">The diagnosis has been identified with a low level of certainty.</items>
              <items id="text">Suspected</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0075">
              <items id="description">The diagnosis has been identified with a high level of certainty.</items>
              <items id="text">Probable</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0076">
              <items id="description">The diagnosis has been confirmed against recognised criteria.</items>
              <items id="text">Confirmed</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0077">
              <items id="comment">Data captured/imported as "Age at onset" should be converted to a date using the subject's date of birth.</items>
              <items id="description">Estimated or actual date/time that signs or symptoms of the problem/diagnosis were first observed.</items>
              <items id="text">Date/time of onset</items>
            </term_definitions>
          </children>
          <cardinality>
            <is_ordered>false</is_ordered>
            <is_unique>false</is_unique>
            <interval>
              <lower_included>true</lower_included>
              <lower_unbounded>false</lower_unbounded>
              <upper_unbounded>true</upper_unbounded>
              <lower>0</lower>
            </interval>
          </cardinality>
        </attributes>
        <archetype_id>
          <value>openEHR-EHR-SECTION.problems_issues_rcp.v1</value>
        </archetype_id>
        <term_definitions code="at0000">
          <items id="description">Problems and issues heading (AoMRC).</items>
          <items id="text">Problems and issues</items>
        </term_definitions>
      </children>
      <cardinality>
        <is_ordered>false</is_ordered>
        <is_unique>false</is_unique>
        <interval>
          <lower_included>true</lower_included>
          <lower_unbounded>false</lower_unbounded>
          <upper_unbounded>true</upper_unbounded>
          <lower>1</lower>
        </interval>
      </cardinality>
    </attributes>
    <archetype_id>
      <value>openEHR-EHR-COMPOSITION.problem_list.v1</value>
    </archetype_id>
    <template_id>
      <value>IDCR - Problem List.v1</value>
    </template_id>
    <term_definitions code="at0000">
      <items id="description">A persistent and managed list of any combination of diagnoses, problems and/or procedures that may influence clinical decision-making and care provision for the subject of care.</items>
      <items id="text">Problem list</items>
    </term_definitions>
    <term_definitions code="at0002">
      <items id="description">Detail about identified problems, diagnoses, concerns or health issue threads.</items>
      <items id="text">Problems, diagnoses, concerns or Health issue threads</items>
    </term_definitions>
    <term_definitions code="at0003">

request.description:
Implementation Notes

This call allows uploading openEHR operational templates prepared by the openEHR modelling tools.


Response Messages


201  Success.

400  Invalid content (unable to read opt) (TMPL-3602).

401  Unauthenticated - could not authenticate user (SYS-9401).

403  Forbidden - the user does not have the required permissions to execute this request (SYS-9403).

Resource Url

https://ehrscape.code-4-health.org/rest/v1/template/{templateId}/example
Parameters

Parameter  Value  Description  Parameter Type  Data Type
templateId
required
  The ID of the template to load.  path  string
defaultLanguage
optional
  The default language to generate the web template with.  query  string
languages
optional
  Other languages to include in the web template, separated by a comma.  query  string
format
optional

The format of JSON representation of the example composition to return. Default: FLAT.  query  enum
exampleFilter
optional

The type of example to produce - intended for input (sent to the server), output (received back from the server) etc.  query  enum
Try it out!
Implementation Notes

Returns an example of data values for a ThinkEhr web template.

This method will show all the web template paths that can be filled out in order to successfully save a composition in the web template format. It will do its best to generate legal exampledata values for those paths, taking into account the data type and validation constraints.

Two parameters control the output of this call. The format parameter controls whether the produced output will be the web template composition values in either the FLAT or the STRUCTURED (hierarchical) JSON format. The exampleFilter parameter controls whether the example will show the values as they would be submitted to the server (INPUT) or received from the server (OUTPUT), since the latter one is more detailed.

The two language parameters determine the languages that the web template will be generated with before its example values will be produced and returned. See the documentation for the {templateId} call for more information on web template languages.

            <term_definitions code="at0000">
              <items id="comment">Substances include, but are not limited to: a therapeutic substance administered correctly at an appropriate dosage for the individual; food; material derived from plants or animals; or venom from insect stings.</items>
              <items id="description">Risk of harmful or undesirable physiological response which is unique to an individual and associated with exposure to a substance.</items>
              <items id="source">openEHR,FHIR</items>
              <items id="text">Adverse reaction risk</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0001">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">Tree</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0002">
              <items id="comment">Both an individual substance and a substance class are valid entries in 'Substance'. If the value in 'Substance' is an individual substance, it may be duplicated in 'Specific substance'. It is strongly recommended that both 'Substance' and 'Specific substance' be coded with a terminology capable of triggering decision support, where possible. For example: Snomed CT, DM+D, RxNorm, NDFRT, ATC, New Zealand Universal List of Medicines and Australian Medicines Terminology. Free text entry should only be used if there is no appropriate terminology available.</items>
              <items id="description">Identification of a substance, or substance class, that is considered to put the individual at risk of an adverse reaction event.</items>
              <items id="source">openEHR,FHIR,DAM</items>
              <items id="text">Substance</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0006">
              <items id="comment">For example: including reason for flagging a 'Criticality' of 'High risk'; and instructions related to future exposure or administration of the Substance, such as administration within an Intensive Care Unit or under corticosteroid cover.</items>
              <items id="description">Additional narrative about the propensity for the adverse reaction, not captured in other fields.</items>
              <items id="source">openEHR</items>
              <items id="text">Comment</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0009">
              <items id="description">Details about each adverse reaction event linked to exposure to the identified 'Substance'.</items>
              <items id="source">openEHR,FHIR,DAM</items>
              <items id="text">Reaction event</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0010">
              <items id="comment">For example: 'Amoxycillin'. Only an individual substance is a valid entry in 'Specific substance'. If the value in 'Substance' is an individual substance and not a substance class, then it may be duplicated in this data element. It is strongly recommended that 'Specific substance' be coded with a terminology capable of triggering decision support, where possible.  For example: RxNorm, Snomed CT, DM+D, NDFRT, ICD-9, ICD-10, UNI, ATC and CPT. Free text entry should only be used if there is no appropriate terminology available.</items>
              <items id="description">Identification of the substance considered to be responsible for the specific adverse reaction event.</items>
              <items id="source">FHIR, openEHR,DAM</items>
              <items id="text">Specific substance</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0011">
              <items id="comment">Manifestation can be expressed as a single word, phrase or brief description. For example: nausea, rash.  'No reaction'may be appropriate where a previous reaction has been noted but the reaction did not re-occur after further exposure. It is preferable that 'Manifestation' should be coded with a terminology, where possible. The values entered here may be used to display on an application screen as part of a list of adverse reactions, as recommended in the UK NHS CUI guidelines.



Terminologies commonly used include, but are not limited to, SNOMED-CT or ICD10.</items>
              <items id="description">Clinical symptoms and/or signs that are observed or associated with the adverse reaction.</items>
              <items id="source">FHIR, openEHR,DAM</items>
              <items id="text">Manifestation</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0012">
              <items id="description">Narrative description about the adverse reaction as a whole, including details of the manifestation if required.</items>
              <items id="source">FHIR, openEHR</items>
              <items id="text">Reaction description</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0018">
              <items id="description">Narrative description about exposure to the identified 'Specific substance'.</items>
              <items id="source">openEHR</items>
              <items id="text">Exposure description</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0020">
              <items id="comment">Exposure can be more complicated by more than one exposure events leading to a reaction. Further details about the nature of the exposure can be provided by use of additional archetypes in the 'Exposure details' SLOT or as text in the 'Exposure description'.</items>
              <items id="description">Record of the date and/or time of the first exposure to the Substance for this Reaction Event.</items>
              <items id="source">FHIR, openEHR,DAM</items>
              <items id="text">Initial exposure</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0021">
              <items id="description">Statement about the degree of clinical certainty that the identified 'Specific substance' was the cause of the 'Manifestation' in this reaction event.</items>
              <items id="source">FHIR</items>
              <items id="text">Certainty</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0023">
              <items id="description">A reasonable level of clinical certainty that the reaction was caused by the identified 'Specific substance'.</items>
              <items id="source">openEHR</items>
              <items id="text">Likely</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0025">
              <items id="description">The total amount of time the individual was exposed to the identified 'Specific substance'.</items>
              <items id="source">openEHR</items>
              <items id="text">Duration of exposure</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0027">
              <items id="description">Record of the date and/or time of the onset of the reaction.</items>
              <items id="source">openEHR, FHIR, DAM</items>
              <items id="text">Onset of reaction</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0028">
              <items id="description">The total amount of time that the manifestation of the adverse reaction persisted.</items>
              <items id="source">openEHR</items>
              <items id="text">Duration of reaction</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0029">
              <items id="comment">May include structured detail about symptoms; the anatomical location of the manifestation; grading, classification or formal severity assessments such as Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events; or the Multimedia CLUSTER archetype. [Note: FHIR - These would be extensions as specified in a profile.]</items>
              <items id="description">Additional details about the adverse reaction, including anatomical location and Common Toxicity Criteria, can be provided by inclusion of specific archetypes in this SLOT.</items>
              <items id="source">FHIR, openEHR</items>
              <items id="text">Reaction details</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0032">
              <items id="description">Additional narrative about the adverse reaction event not captured in other fields.</items>
              <items id="source">openEHR</items>
              <items id="text">Reaction comment</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0040">
              <items id="description">Narrative description about the clinical management provided.</items>
              <items id="source">openEHR</items>
              <items id="text">Clinical management description</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0041">
              <items id="description">Additional structured details required for reporting to regulatory bodies can be provided by inclusion of specific archetypes in this SLOT.</items>
              <items id="source">FHIR, openEHR</items>
              <items id="text">Reporting details</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0042">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">Tree</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0044">
              <items id="description">Has the adverse reaction ever been reported to a regulatory body?</items>
              <items id="source">openEHR</items>
              <items id="text">Reaction reported?</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0045">
              <items id="description">Link to an adverse reaction Report sent to a regulatory body.</items>
              <items id="source">openEHR</items>
              <items id="text">Adverse reaction report</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0047">
              <items id="comment">For example, presenting symptoms, examination findings, diagnosis etc.
 [Note: FHIR,DAM: Maps to Sensitivity Test.]</items>
              <items id="description">Link to further information about the presentation and findings that exist elsewhere in the health record, including allergy test reports.</items>
              <items id="source">FHIR, openEHR, DAM</items>
              <items id="text">Supporting clinical record information</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0048">
              <items id="comment">For example, the reason for non-reporting.</items>
              <items id="description">Narrative about the adverse reaction report or reporting process.</items>
              <items id="source">openEHR</items>
              <items id="text">Report comment</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0058">
              <items id="comment">Immune-mediated responses have been traditionally regarded as an indicator for escalation of significant future risk. Contemporary knowledge suggests that some reactions previously thought to be immune are actually non-immune and still carry life threatening risk. 

Immunological testing may provide supporting evidence for the mechanism and causative substance , but no tests are 100% sensitive or specific for a sensitivity. 

It is acknowledged that most clinicians will NOT be able to distinguish the mechanism of any specific reaction. However this data element is included because many legacy systems have captured this attribute.</items>
              <items id="description">Identification of the underlying physiological mechanism for the adverse reaction.</items>
              <items id="source">FHIR, DAM</items>
              <items id="text">Reaction mechanism</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0059">
              <items id="description">Immune mediated reaction, including allergic reactions and hypersensitivities.</items>
              <items id="text">Immune mediated</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0060">
              <items id="description">A non-immune mediated reaction, which can include pseudo-allergic reactions, side effects, intolerances, drug toxicities (for example, to Gentamicin).</items>
              <items id="text">Non-immune mediated</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0062">
              <items id="comment">Note: maps to recordedDate in FHIR.</items>
              <items id="description">Date when the propensity or the reaction event was updated.</items>
              <items id="source">openEHR, FHIR, DAM</items>
              <items id="text">Last updated</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0063">
              <items id="comment">Decision support would typically raise alerts for 'Suspected', 'Likely', 'Confirmed', and ignore a 'Refuted' reaction. Clinical systems may choose not to display Adverse reaction entries with a 


'Refuted' status in the Adverse Reaction List. 

However, 'Refuted' may be useful for reconciliation of the adverse reaction list or when communicating between systems

. Some implementations may choose to make this field mandatory.
 'Resolved' may be used variably across systems, depending on clinical use and context - there appears to be differing opinion whether this should still be used to raise potential alerts or to display in an Adverse Reaction List. The free text data type will allow for local variation by enabling other value sets to be applied to this data element in a template - in this situation it is recommended that values should be coded using a terminology.</items>
              <items id="description">Assertion about the certainty of the propensity, or potential future risk, of the identified 'Substance' to cause a reaction.</items>
              <items id="source">FHIR, DAM</items>
              <items id="text">Status</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0064">
              <items id="description">A reasonable level of certainty about the propensity for a reaction to the identified 'Substance'.</items>
              <items id="text">Likely</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0065">
              <items id="description">A high level of certainty about the propensity for a reaction to the identified 'Substance', which may include clinical evidence by testing or re-challenge.</items>
              <items id="text">Confirmed</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0066">
              <items id="description">The propensity for a reaction to the identified 'Substance' has been clinically reassessed or has been disproved with a high level of clinical certainty by re-exposure or deliberate challenge.</items>
              <items id="text">Refuted</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0067">
              <items id="description">The previously known reaction to the identified 'Substance' has been clinically reassessed and considered no longer to be an active risk.</items>
              <items id="text">Resolved</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0089">
              <items id="comment">It is acknowledged that this assessment is very subjective. There may be some some specific practice domains where objective scales have been applied.
 Objective scales can be included in this model using the 'Reaction details' Cluster.</items>
              <items id="description">Clinical assessment of the severity of the reaction event as a whole, potentially considering multiple different manifestations.</items>
              <items id="source">DAM</items>
              <items id="text">Severity of reaction</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0090">
              <items id="description">Causes severe physiological effects.</items>
              <items id="source">FHIR</items>
              <items id="text">Severe</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0092">
              <items id="description">Causes moderate physiological effects.</items>
              <items id="source">FHIR</items>
              <items id="text">Moderate</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0093">
              <items id="description">Causes mild physiological effects.</items>
              <items id="source">FHIR</items>
              <items id="text">Mild</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0095">
              <items id="description">A low level of clinical certainty that the reaction was caused by the identified 'Specific substance'.</items>
              <items id="text">Suspected</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0096">
              <items id="description">Additional details about exposure to the 'Specific substance', especially in situations where there may have been multiple or cumulative exposures can be provided by inclusion of specific archetypes in this SLOT.</items>
              <items id="text">Exposure details</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0099">
              <items id="description">Structured details about reports that have been forwarded to regulatory bodies.</items>
              <items id="text">Report summary</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0101">
              <items id="comment">This can be regarded as a predictive judgement of a 'worst case scenario'.
 In most contexts 'Low' would be regarded as the default value.</items>
              <items id="description">An indication of the potential for critical system organ damage or life threatening consequence.</items>
              <items id="source">DAM, openEHR</items>
              <items id="text">Criticality</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0102">
              <items id="description">Exposure to substance unlikely to result in critical system organ damage or life threatening consequence. Future exposure to the identified 'Substance' should be considered a relative contra-indication in normal clinical circumstances.</items>
              <items id="text">Low</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0103">
              <items id="description">Exposure to substance may result in critical organ system damage or life threatening consequence. Future exposure to the identified 'Substance' should be considered an absolute contra-indication in normal clinical circumstances.</items>
              <items id="text">High</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0106">
              <items id="comment">Coding of the Route of Exposure with a terminology should be used wherever possible.</items>
              <items id="description">Identification of the route by which the subject was exposed to the identified 'Specific substance'.</items>
              <items id="source">FHIR, DAM</items>
              <items id="text">Route of exposure</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0116">
              <items id="description">Details about the provenance of the information can be provided by inclusion of specific archetypes in this SLOT.</items>
              <items id="text">Information source</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0117">
              <items id="comment">This date may be be a duplicate of the most recent 'Onset of reaction' date.
 Where a textual representation of the date of last occurrence is required e.g 'In Childhood, '10 years ago' the Comment element should be used.</items>
              <items id="description">The date and/or time of the onset of the last known occurrence of a reaction event.</items>
              <items id="source">IMH</items>
              <items id="text">Onset of last reaction</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0118">
              <items id="description">A high level of clinical certainty that the reaction was due to the identified 'Substance', which may include clinical evidence by testing or re-challenge.</items>
              <items id="text">Confirmed</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0119">
              <items id="description">Additional structured details about clinical management for this reaction event can be provided by inclusion of specific archetypes in this SLOT.</items>
              <items id="text">Clinical management details</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0120">
              <items id="comment">This data element has been included because it is currently being captured in some clinical systems. This data can be derived from the Substance where coding systems are used, and is effectively redundant in that situation.</items>
              <items id="description">Category of the identified 'Substance'.</items>
              <items id="text">Category</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0121">
              <items id="description">Any substance consumed to provide nutritional support for the body, such as peanut or egg.</items>
              <items id="text">Food</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0122">
              <items id="description">Any substance administered to achieve a physiological effect.</items>
              <items id="text">Medication</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0123">
              <items id="description">Any other substance encountered including venom, latex and other environmental substances.</items>
              <items id="text">Other</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0124">
              <items id="description">Unable to assess with information available.</items>
              <items id="text">Indeterminate</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0125">
              <items id="description">Date that the report was sent to the regulatory authority.</items>
              <items id="text">Date of report</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0126">
              <items id="description">The physiological mechanism could not be determined.</items>
              <items id="text">Indeterminate</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0127">
              <items id="description">A low level of clinical certainty about the propensity of a reaction to the identified 'Substance'.</items>
              <items id="text">Suspected</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0128">
              <items id="comment">For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.</items>
              <items id="description">Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.</items>
              <items id="text">Extension</items>
            </term_definitions>
          </children>
          <cardinality>
            <is_ordered>false</is_ordered>
            <is_unique>false</is_unique>
            <interval>
              <lower_included>true</lower_included>
              <lower_unbounded>false</lower_unbounded>
              <upper_unbounded>true</upper_unbounded>
              <lower>0</lower>
            </interval>
          </cardinality>
        </attributes>
        <archetype_id>
          <value>openEHR-EHR-SECTION.allergies_adverse_reactions_rcp.v1</value>
        </archetype_id>
        <term_definitions code="at0000">
          <items id="description">Allergies and adverse reactions heading (AoMRC).</items>
          <items id="text">Allergies and adverse reactions</items>
        </term_definitions>
      </children>
      <cardinality>
        <is_ordered>false</is_ordered>
        <is_unique>false</is_unique>
        <interval>
          <lower_included>true</lower_included>
          <lower_unbounded>false</lower_unbounded>
          <upper_unbounded>true</upper_unbounded>
          <lower>0</lower>
        </interval>
      </cardinality>
    </attributes>
    <archetype_id>
      <value>openEHR-EHR-COMPOSITION.adverse_reaction_list.v1</value>
    </archetype_id>
    <template_id>
      <value>IDCR -  Adverse Reaction List.v1</value>
    </template_id>
    <term_definitions code="at0000">
      <items id="description">A persistent and managed list of adverse reactions experienced by the subject that may influence clinical decision-making and care provision.</items>
      <items id="text">Adverse reaction list</items>
    </term_definitions>
    <term_definitions code="at0001">
      <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
      <items id="text">Tree</items>
    </term_definitions>
    <term_definitions code="at0002">
      <items id="comment">For example: Local hospital departmental infomation or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.</items>
      <items id="description">Additional information required to capture local context or to align with other reference models/formalisms.</items>
      <items id="text">Extension</items>
    </term_definitions>
  </definition>
  <view>
    <constraints path="[openEHR-EHR-COMPOSITION.adverse_reaction_list.v1]/content[openEHR-EHR-SECTION.allergies_adverse_reactions_rcp.v1]/items[openEHR-EHR-EVALUATION.adverse_reaction_risk.v1]/data[at0001]">
      <items id="pass_through">
        <value>true</value>
      </items>
    </constraints>
    <constraints path="[openEHR-EHR-COMPOSITION.adverse_reaction_list.v1]/context/other_context[at0001]">
      <items id="pass_through">
        <value>true</value>
      </items>
    </constraints>
  </view>
</template>

request.description:
Implementation Notes

This call allows uploading openEHR operational templates prepared by the openEHR modelling tools.


Response Messages


201  Success.

400  Invalid content (unable to read opt) (TMPL-3602).

401  Unauthenticated - could not authenticate user (SYS-9401).

403  Forbidden - the user does not have the required permissions to execute this request (SYS-9403).

Resource Url

https://ehrscape.code-4-health.org/rest/v1/template/{templateId}/example
Parameters

Parameter  Value  Description  Parameter Type  Data Type
templateId
required
  The ID of the template to load.  path  string
defaultLanguage
optional
  The default language to generate the web template with.  query  string
languages
optional
  Other languages to include in the web template, separated by a comma.  query  string
format
optional

The format of JSON representation of the example composition to return. Default: FLAT.  query  enum
exampleFilter
optional

The type of example to produce - intended for input (sent to the server), output (received back from the server) etc.  query  enum
Try it out!
Implementation Notes

Returns an example of data values for a ThinkEhr web template.

This method will show all the web template paths that can be filled out in order to successfully save a composition in the web template format. It will do its best to generate legal exampledata values for those paths, taking into account the data type and validation constraints.

Two parameters control the output of this call. The format parameter controls whether the produced output will be the web template composition values in either the FLAT or the STRUCTURED (hierarchical) JSON format. The exampleFilter parameter controls whether the example will show the values as they would be submitted to the server (INPUT) or received from the server (OUTPUT), since the latter one is more detailed.

The two language parameters determine the languages that the web template will be generated with before its example values will be produced and returned. See the documentation for the {templateId} call for more information on web template languages.

                        </archetype_id>
                        <term_definitions code="at0000">
                          <items id="description">To record details of a laboratory specimen.</items>
                          <items id="text">Specimen</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0001">
                          <items id="comment">Sometimes called the Accession Identifier.</items>
                          <items id="description">Unique identifier of the specimen, normally assigned by the laboratory.</items>
                          <items id="fhir_mapping">Specimen.accessionIdentifier</items>
                          <items id="text">Laboratory specimen identifier</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0003">
                          <items id="description">Unique identifier of the parent specimen, where the specimen is split into sub-samples.</items>
                          <items id="text">Parent specimen identifier</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0005">
                          <items id="description">Any risk or biohazard associated with collecting or handling the specimen.</items>
                          <items id="text">Potential risk</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0007">
                          <items id="description">The method of collection to be used eg Venepuncture, biopsy, resection.</items>
                          <items id="fhir_mapping">Specimen.collection.method</items>
                          <items id="text">Collection method</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0008">
                          <items id="comment"> e.g. fasting, 'full bladder', 'sterile field' or any special instructions on the handling or immediate processing of the sample e.g. centrifuge on receipt. 

Can also be used to document any known deviations from collection or handling instructions e.g patient was not fasted.</items>
                          <items id="description">Any conditions to be met before the sample should be taken.</items>
                          <items id="text">Sampling conditions</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0013">
                          <items id="description">The anatomical site(s) from where the specimen was taken.</items>
                          <items id="fhir_mapping">Specimen.collection.sourceSite</items>
                          <items id="text">Source site</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0015">
                          <items id="description">The date and time that collection has been ordered to take place or has taken place.</items>
                          <items id="text">Datetime collected</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0027">
                          <items id="description">Dimensions / weight / quantity of sample or other physical details of a bodily fluid. Set as unbounded to allow variations e.g Weight of prostatic gland with and without seminal vesicles.</items>
                          <items id="fhir_mappings">Specimen.collection.quantity</items>
                          <items id="text">Physical properties</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0029">
                          <items id="description">The type of specimen to be collected e.g venous blood, prostatic biopsy.</items>
                          <items id="fhir_mapping">Specimen.type</items>
                          <items id="text">Specimen type</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0034">
                          <items id="description">The date and time that the sample was received at the laboratory.</items>
                          <items id="fhir_mapping">Specimen.receivedTime</items>
                          <items id="text">Datetime received</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0039">
                          <items id="description">Problems with the received specimen.</items>
                          <items id="text">Specimen quality</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0041">
                          <items id="description">Is the specimen adequate for testing?</items>
                          <items id="text">Adequacy for testing</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0042">
                          <items id="description">Specific issue with a received specimen.</items>
                          <items id="text">Specimen received issues</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0044">
                          <items id="description">Issue arising with handling or processing of the specimen within the laboratory.</items>
                          <items id="text">Laboratory handling issues</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0045">
                          <items id="description">An additional text comment on the quality of the received specimen.</items>
                          <items id="text">Comment</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0046">
                          <items id="description">Workflow of specimen processing/handling.</items>
                          <items id="text">Processing</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0052">
                          <items id="description">The specimen was haemolysed.</items>
                          <items id="text">Haemolysed</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0053">
                          <items id="description">The specimen was lipaemic.</items>
                          <items id="text">Lipaemic</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0054">
                          <items id="description">An incorrect preservative was used when transporting the specimen.</items>
                          <items id="text">Incorrect transport medium</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0055">
                          <items id="description">An insufficient sample was given to undertake measurement.</items>
                          <items id="text">Insufficient sample</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0056">
                          <items id="description">An error arose when handling the specimen.</items>
                          <items id="text">Handling error</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0057">
                          <items id="description">The specimen was too old to analyse accurately.</items>
                          <items id="text">Age</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0058">
                          <items id="description">An accident occurred with the sample in the laboratory.</items>
                          <items id="text">Laboratory accident</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0059">
                          <items id="description">The specimen could not be analysed for technical reasons.</items>
                          <items id="text">Technical failure</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0062">
                          <items id="description">The specimen is of sufficient quality to allow reporting.</items>
                          <items id="text">Satisfactory</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0063">
                          <items id="description">The specimen is unsatisfactory but has been processed.</items>
                          <items id="text">Unsatisfactory - processed</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0064">
                          <items id="description">The specimen is unsatisfactory and has not been processed.</items>
                          <items id="text">Unsatisfactory - not processed</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0067">
                          <items id="comment">This specifies the specimen collection location within the healthcare
environment. It enables the laboratory to ask questions about the
collection of the specimen, if required. The specimen collection
setting may provide additional information relevant to the analysis 
of the result.</items>
                          <items id="description">Identification of the setting at which the specimen was collected 
from a subject of care. The specimen is often collected by a 
healthcare provider, but may be collected directly by the patient or carer at home.</items>
                          <items id="text">Collection setting</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0068">
                          <items id="description">The specimen preparation cluster allows detailed recording of a particular preparation step e.g staining or fixation.</items>
                          <items id="text">Processing details</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0070">
                          <items id="description">Identifier of the person or agency responsible for collecting the specimen.</items>
                          <items id="fhir_mapping">Specimen.collection.collector</items>
                          <items id="text">Specimen collector identifier</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0071">
                          <items id="description">The person or organisation responsible for collecting the specimen.</items>
                          <items id="fhir_mapping">Specimen.collection.collector</items>
                          <items id="text">Specimen collector details</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0079">
                          <items id="description">Additional detailed description of method of sample collection.</items>
                          <items id="text">Collection method description</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0080">
                          <items id="description">The total number of containers holding this specimen.</items>
                          <items id="text">Number of containers</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0081">
                          <items id="description">Details of a related specimen.</items>
                          <items id="text">Related specimen</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0083">
                          <items id="description">Addtional details related to specific collection methods e.g. needle biopsy.</items>
                          <items id="text">Additional collection details</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0085">
                          <items id="description">Details of container(s) used.</items>
                          <items id="text">Container details</items>
                        </term_definitions>

                        <term_definitions code="at0000">
                          <items id="description">Laboratory test result as a single value or in a panel/battery format common to clinical pathology testing.</items>
                          <items id="text">Laboratory test panel</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0001">
                          <items id="description">Actual value of the result. The name of this element is normally replaced in a template or at run-time to relfect the actual analyte e.g. Serum sodium and will often be coded.</items>
                          <items id="fhir_mapping">Observation.result; Observation.name</items>
                          <items id="hl7v2_mapping">OBX.2,OBX.5,OBX.6; OBX-3-observation identifier</items>
                          <items id="text">Result value</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0002">
                          <items id="description">Specific detailed result, including both the value of the result item, and additional information that may be useful for clinical interpretation.</items>
                          <items id="text">Laboratory result</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0003">
                          <items id="description">Comment about the Result.</items>
                          <items id="fhir_mapping">Observation.comments</items>
                          <items id="hl7v2_mapping">NTE.3</items>
                          <items id="text">Comment</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0004">
                          <items id="description">Additional advice on the applicability of the reference range.</items>
                          <items id="text">Reference range guidance</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0005">
                          <items id="description">The status of the result value.</items>
                          <items id="fhir_mapping">status</items>
                          <items id="hl7v2_mapping">OBX-11-observation result status</items>
                          <items id="text">Result status</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0006">
                          <items id="description">The date and/or time that the entire result was issued for the recorded ‘Result status’.</items>
                          <items id="fhir_mapping">Observation.issued</items>
                          <items id="hl7v2_mapping">OBX-22 and/or OBX-19</items>
                          <items id="text">Result status timestamp</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0007">
                          <items id="description">No result yet available.</items>
                          <items id="text">Registered</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0008">
                          <items id="description">This is an initial or interim result: data may be missing or verification not been performed.</items>
                          <items id="text">Interim</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0009">
                          <items id="description">The result is complete and verified by the responsible pathologist.</items>
                          <items id="text">Final</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0010">
                          <items id="description">The result has been modified subsequent to being Final, and is complete and verified by the responsible pathologist.</items>
                          <items id="text">Amended</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0011">
                          <items id="description">The result is unavailable because the test was not started or not completed.</items>
                          <items id="text">Cancelled/Aborted</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0012">
                          <items id="description">The result is not available as the test was not requested.</items>
                          <items id="text">Not requested</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0013">
                          <items id="description">Further details including the specimen for the panel or a further nested panel.</items>
                          <items id="text">Other detail</items>
