        <archetype_id>
          <value>openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.laboratory_test.v0</value>
        </archetype_id>
        <term_definitions code="at0000">
          <items id="comment">This archetype may be used to record a single valued test, but will often be specialised or templated to represent multiple value or 'panel' tests. This archetype also acts as the parent for specialisations appropriate for more specific laboratory tests, e.g. microbiology, histopathology.</items>
          <items id="description">The findings and interpretation of a pathology laboratory test performed on patient-related specimens.</items>
          <items id="text">Laboratory test</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0001">
          <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
          <items id="text">Event Series</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0002">
          <items id="description">Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.</items>
          <items id="text">Any event</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0003">
          <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
          <items id="text">Tree</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0004">
          <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
          <items id="text">Tree</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0005">
          <items id="comment">A test result may be for a single analyte, or a group of items, including panel tests. Coding with a terminology, potientially a pre-coordinated term including specimen type, is preferred, where possible. May be coded with LOINC or Snomed-CT. Examples include "Glucose", "Urea and Electrolytes", "Swab",  “Cortisol (am)” or "Liver Biopsy".</items>
          <items id="description">Identification of the pathology test performed, sometimes including specimen type and patient state.</items>
          <items id="fhirmapping">Diagnostic.Reportname</items>
          <items id="fhirvalueset">reportnames</items>
          <items id="text">Test name</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0010">
          <items id="comment">Multiple formats are allowed but they must be semantically equivalent.</items>
          <items id="description">Rich text or other multimedia  representation of the entire result as issued by the diagnostic service.</items>
          <items id="fhir_mapping">DiagnosticReport.presentedForm</items>
          <items id="text">Test representation</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0017">
          <items id="description">Demographic details of the laboratory with responsibility for the test.</items>
          <items id="fhir_mapping">DiagnosticReport.performer</items>
          <items id="text">Responsible laboratory</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0035">
          <items id="description">Details of a clinician or organisation who will receive a copy of the laboratory test result.</items>
          <items id="text">Distribution list</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0037">
          <items id="description">This is a partial (e.g. initial, interim or preliminary) Test Result: data in the Test Result may be incomplete or unverified.</items>
          <items id="text">Partial</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0038">
          <items id="description">The Test result is complete and verified by an authorised person.</items>
          <items id="text">Final</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0040">
          <items id="description">The result has been modified subsequent to being Final, and is complete and verified by the responsible pathologist, and result data has been changed.</items>
          <items id="text">Amended</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0057">
          <items id="description">Concise and clinically contextualised narrative interpretation of the laboratory test results.</items>
          <items id="fhir_mapping">DiagnosticReport.conclusion</items>
          <items id="text">Conclusion</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0062">
          <items id="comment">Equivalent to the HL7 Placer Order Identifier.</items>
          <items id="description">The local ID assigned to the test order by the order requester.</items>
          <items id="text">Requester order identifier</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0063">
          <items id="comment">Assigning an identifier to a request by the Laboratory lnformation System (LIS) enables tracking progress of the request and enables linking results to requests. It also provides a reference to assist with enquiries and it is usually equivalent to the HL7 Filler Order Identifier.</items>
          <items id="description">The local ID assigned to the test order by the order filler, usually by the Laboratory Information System (LIS).</items>
          <items id="text">Receiver order identifier</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0065">
          <items id="description">Details about the specimen if all individual test results are derived from the same specimen. If the specimen type is sufficiently specified with a code in the Test result name, then this additional data is not required.  If there are multiple specimens, these may be represented per 'Result group'.</items>
          <items id="fhir_Mapping">DiagnosticReport.specimen</items>
          <items id="text">Specimen detail</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0068">
          <items id="description">The local identifier given to the laboratory test result  by the Laboratory Information System.</items>
          <items id="fhir_mapping">DiagnosticReport.identifier</items>
          <items id="text">Laboratory test identifier</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0073">
          <items id="description">The status of the laboratory test result as a whole.</items>
          <items id="fhir_mapping">DiagnosticReport.status</items>
          <items id="text">Test status</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0074">
          <items id="description">The result is unavailable because the test was not started or not completed (also sometimes called 'aborted').</items>
          <items id="text">Cancelled</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0075">
          <items id="description">The date and/or time that the entire result was issued for the recorded ‘Test Report Status’.</items>
          <items id="fhir_mapping">DiagnosticReport.issued</items>
          <items id="text">Test status timestamp</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0077">
          <items id="comment">For example, biochemistry, haematology. This helps clinicians filter for broad categories of results accoridng to local laboratory arrangements. Coding with a terminology is desirable, where possible.
</items>
          <items id="description">The diagnostic service that performs the examination.</items>
          <items id="fhir_mapping">DiagnosticReport.serviceCategory</items>
          <items id="fhir_valueset">diagnostic-service-sections</items>
          <items id="text">Diagnostic service category</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0090">
          <items id="description">Details of the clinician or organisation requesting the laboratory test result.</items>
          <items id="text">Requester</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0094">
          <items id="comment">Usually there is one test request (or "order") for each result, however in some circumstances multiple test requests may be represented using a single Pathology test result archetype.</items>
          <items id="description">Details concerning a single laboratory test requested.</items>
          <items id="fhir_mapping">DiagnosticReport.requestDetail</items>
          <items id="text">Test request details</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0097">
          <items id="description">Details about the  reported results, possibly an individual analyte, a group, panel or battery of multiple results, or a more complex and specific structure.</items>
          <items id="fhir_mapping">DiagnosticReport.result</items>
          <items id="text">Test findings</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0098">
          <items id="comment">Coding with a terminology is preferred, where possible.</items>
          <items id="description">Single word, phrase or brief description representing the narrative in the 'Conclusion'.</items>
          <items id="fhir_mapping">DiagnosticReport.codedDiagnosis</items>
          <items id="text">Pathological diagnosis</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0100">
          <items id="comment">In HL7 fhir this information is held within the linked requestDetail.clinical Notes.</items>
          <items id="description">Description of clinical information available at the time of interpretation of results, which may include a link to the original clinical information provided in the test request.</items>
          <items id="fhir_mapping">DiagnosticReport.requestDetail.clinicalNotes</items>
          <items id="text">Clinical information provided</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0101">
          <items id="description">Additional narrative about the test not captured in other fields.</items>
          <items id="text">Comment</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0106">
          <items id="description">Identification of the original laboratory test requested, where the test requested differs from the test actually performed.</items>
          <items id="text">Original test requested Name</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0107">
          <items id="description">The existence of the test is registered in the Laboratory Information System, but there is nothing yet available.</items>
          <items id="text">Registered</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0110">
          <items id="description">Additional structured details of laboratory test methodology followed. For example, structured details about the laboratory method and data interpretation used.</items>
          <items id="text">Test method/device details</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0111">
          <items id="description">True if a point of care device supplies the test result rather than a formal laboratory service.</items>
          <items id="text">Point of care device</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0112">
          <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
          <items id="text">Tree</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0113">
          <items id="description">Aspects of the condition or circumstances of the patient that may alter interpretation of the laboratory test.</items>
          <items id="text">Confounding factors</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0114">
          <items id="description">Details of patient state that may alter interpretation of the laboratory test.</items>
          <items id="text">Patient state details</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0115">
          <items id="description">The result has been modified subsequent to being Final, and is complete and verified by the responsible pathologist.</items>
          <items id="text">Corrected</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0116">
          <items id="description">The Test Result has been withdrawn following previous Final release.</items>
          <items id="text">Entered in error</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0117">
          <items id="description">Slot to allow extension to support localisation or alignment with other standards/ reference models.</items>
          <items id="text">Extension</items>
        </term_definitions>
      </children>
      <cardinality>
        <is_ordered>false</is_ordered>
        <is_unique>false</is_unique>
        <interval>
          <lower_included>true</lower_included>
          <lower_unbounded>false</lower_unbounded>
          <upper_unbounded>true</upper_unbounded>
          <lower>0</lower>
        </interval>
      </cardinality>
    </attributes>
    <archetype_id>
      <value>openEHR-EHR-COMPOSITION.report-result.v1</value>
    </archetype_id>
    <template_id>
      <value>IDCR - Laboratory Test Report.v0</value>
    </template_id>
    <term_definitions code="at0000">
      <items id="description">Document to communicate information to others, commonly in response to a request from another party.</items>
      <items id="text">Report</items>
    </term_definitions>
    <term_definitions code="at0000.1">
      <items id="description">Document to communicate information to others about the result of a test or assessment.</items>
      <items id="text">Result Report</items>
    </term_definitions>
    <term_definitions code="at0001">
      <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
      <items id="text">Tree</items>
    </term_definitions>
    <term_definitions code="at0002">
      <items id="description">Identification information about the report.</items>
      <items id="text">Report ID</items>
    </term_definitions>
    <term_definitions code="at0005">
      <items id="description">The status of the entire report. Note: This is not the status of any of the report components.</items>
      <items id="text">Status</items>
    </term_definitions>
    <term_definitions code="at0006">
      <items id="comment">For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.</items>
      <items id="description">Additional information required to capture local context or to align with other reference models/formalisms.</items>
      <items id="text">Extension</items>
    </term_definitions>
  </definition>
  <view>
    <constraints path="[openEHR-EHR-COMPOSITION.report-result.v1]/content[openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.laboratory_test.v0]/data[at0001]">

request.description:
Implementation Notes

This call allows uploading openEHR operational templates prepared by the openEHR modelling tools.


Response Messages


201  Success.

400  Invalid content (unable to read opt) (TMPL-3602).

401  Unauthenticated - could not authenticate user (SYS-9401).

403  Forbidden - the user does not have the required permissions to execute this request (SYS-9403).

        <archetype_id>
          <value>openEHR-EHR-ACTION.service.v0</value>
        </archetype_id>
        <term_definitions code="at0000">
          <items id="description">A general clinical activity carried out for the patient to receive a specified service, advice or care from an expert healthcare provider.</items>
          <items id="text">Service</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0001">
          <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
          <items id="text">Tree</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0002">
          <items id="description">Service request to healthcare provider is planned.</items>
          <items id="text">Service planned</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0003">
          <items id="description">Appointment for a healthcare provider service has been made.</items>
          <items id="text">Service scheduled</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0004">
          <items id="description">The healthcare provider has delivered the service.</items>
          <items id="text">Service delivered</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0005">
          <items id="description">All service activities have been completed.</items>
          <items id="text">Service activity complete</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0006">
          <items id="description">The referral has been ceased before the service has been completed.</items>
          <items id="text">Service abandoned</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0008">
          <items id="description">The planned service has been postponed.</items>
          <items id="text">Service postponed</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0009">
          <items id="description">The planned service has been cancelled prior to commencement.</items>
          <items id="text">Service cancelled</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0010">
          <items id="description">The service has been suspended without completion.</items>
          <items id="text">Service suspended</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0011">
          <items id="comment">Coding of the specific service name with a terminology is preferred, where possible.</items>
          <items id="description">Identification of the clinical service to be/being carried out.</items>
          <items id="text">Service name</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0012">
          <items id="comment">For example: the reason for the cancellation or suspension of the service.</items>
          <items id="description">Reason that the activity or care pathway step for the identified service was carried out.</items>
          <items id="text">Reason</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0013">
          <items id="description">Narrative description about the service, as appropriate for the pathway step.</items>
          <items id="text">Description</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0014">
          <items id="description">Type of service to be carried out or being carried out.</items>
          <items id="text">Service type</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0015">
          <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
          <items id="text">Tree</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0016">
          <items id="description">The local ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service. This is also referred to as Placer Order Identifier.</items>
          <items id="text">Requestor identifier</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0017">
          <items id="description">Details about the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service.</items>
          <items id="text">Requestor</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0018">
          <items id="description">The ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for referral. This is also referred to as Filler Order Identifier.</items>
          <items id="text">Receiver identifier</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0019">
          <items id="description">Details about the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for referral.</items>
          <items id="text">Receiver</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0021">
          <items id="comment">Only for use in association with the 'Service delivered' pathway step. For example: record that this is the 3rd physiotherapy appointment in a planned sequence.</items>
          <items id="description">The sequence of the specified clinical service.</items>

request.description:
Implementation Notes

This call allows uploading openEHR operational templates prepared by the openEHR modelling tools.


Response Messages


201  Success.

400  Invalid content (unable to read opt) (TMPL-3602).

401  Unauthenticated - could not authenticate user (SYS-9401).

403  Forbidden - the user does not have the required permissions to execute this request (SYS-9403).

            <archetype_id>
              <value>openEHR-EHR-ACTION.procedure.v1</value>
            </archetype_id>
            <term_definitions code="at0000">
              <items id="description">A clinical activity carried out for screening, investigative, diagnostic, curative, therapeutic, evaluative or palliative purposes.</items>
              <items id="text">Procedure</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0001">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">Tree</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0002">
              <items id="comment">Coding of the specific procedure with a terminology is preferred, where possible.</items>
              <items id="description">Identification of the procedure by name.</items>
              <items id="text">Procedure name</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0003">
              <items id="comment">Use to capture detailed, structured information about anatomical location, method & technique, equipment used, devices implanted, results, findings etc.</items>
              <items id="description">Structured information about the procedure.</items>
              <items id="text">Procedure detail</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0004">
              <items id="description">The procedure to be undertaken is planned.</items>
              <items id="text">Procedure planned</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0005">
              <items id="description">Additional narrative about the activity or care pathway step not captured in other fields.</items>
              <items id="text">Comment</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0006">
              <items id="comment">Use this data element to record simple terms or precoordinated complications. If the requirements for recording complication are more complex then use of a specific CLUSTER archetype within the 'Procedure detail' SLOT in this archetype is advised and this data element becomes redundant. Examples: Hematuria after a kidney biopsy, tissue irritation after insertion of intravenous catheter.</items>
              <items id="description">Details about any complication arising from the procedure.</items>
              <items id="text">Complication</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0007">
              <items id="description">Request for procedure sent.</items>
              <items id="text">Procedure request sent</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0014">
              <items id="comment">For example: the reason for the cancellation or suspension of the procedure.</items>
              <items id="description">Reason that the activity or care pathway step for the identified procedure was carried out.</items>
              <items id="text">Reason</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0034">
              <items id="comment">(Was: The procedure to be undertaken is planned.)</items>
              <items id="description">This pathway step has been deprecated as it was incorrectly associated with 'initial' status - use the new 'Procedure planned' (at0004) pathway step  which is correctly associated with 'planned' status.</items>
              <items id="text">X - Procedure planned</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0035">
              <items id="comment">(Was: Request for procedure sent.)</items>
              <items id="description">This pathway step has been deprecated as it was incorrectly associated with 'initial' status - use the new 'Procedure request sent' (at0007) pathway step  which is correctly associated with 'planned' status.</items>
              <items id="text">X - Procedure request sent</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0036">
              <items id="description">The procedure has been scheduled.</items>
              <items id="text">Procedure scheduled</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0038">
              <items id="description">The procedure has been postponed.</items>
              <items id="text">Procedure postponed</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0039">
              <items id="description">The planned procedure has been cancelled prior to commencement.</items>
              <items id="text">Procedure cancelled</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0040">
              <items id="description">The procedure has been suspended.</items>
              <items id="text">Procedure suspended</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0041">
              <items id="description">The procedure has been aborted.</items>
              <items id="text">Procedure aborted</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0043">
              <items id="description">The procedure has been performed and all associated clinical activities completed.</items>
              <items id="text">Procedure completed</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0047">
              <items id="description">The procedure, or subprocedure in a multicomponent procedure, has been performed.</items>
              <items id="text">Procedure performed</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0048">
              <items id="comment">Coding with a terminology is preferred, where possible.</items>
              <items id="description">Outcome of procedure performed.</items>
              <items id="text">Outcome</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0049">
              <items id="comment">For example: description about the performance and findings from the the procedure, the aborted attempt or the cancellation of the procedure.</items>
              <items id="description">Narrative description about the procedure, as appropriate for the pathway step.</items>
              <items id="text">Description</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0053">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">Tree</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0054">
              <items id="comment">This is equivalent to Placer Order Number in HL7 v2 specifications.</items>
              <items id="description">The local ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service.</items>
              <items id="text">Requestor order identifier</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0055">
              <items id="description">Details about the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service.</items>
              <items id="text">Requestor</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0056">
              <items id="comment">This is equivalent to Filler Order Number in HL7 v2 specifications.</items>
              <items id="description">The ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for service. This is also referred to as Filler Order Identifier.</items>
              <items id="text">Receiver order identifier</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0057">
              <items id="description">Details about the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for service.</items>
              <items id="text">Receiver</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0058">
              <items id="comment">Coding with a terminology is preferred, where possible.</items>
              <items id="description">Urgency of the procedure.</items>
              <items id="text">Urgency</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0060">
              <items id="comment">Only for use in association with the 'Procedure performed' pathway step, and in situations where the procedure is repeated on multiple occasions before being completed or there are multiple components to the whole procedure. This may be the same as the RM time attribute for the 'Procedure completed' pathway step.</items>
              <items id="description">The date and/or time when the entire procedure, or the last component of a multicomponent procedure, was finished.</items>
              <items id="text">Final end date/time</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0061">
              <items id="comment">Only for use in association with the 'Procedure completed' pathway steps.</items>
              <items id="description">The total amount of time taken to complete the procedure, which may include time spent during the active phase of the procedure plus time during which the procedure was suspended.</items>
              <items id="text">Total duration</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0062">
              <items id="description">Mulitimedia representation of a performed procedure.</items>
              <items id="text">Multimedia</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0063">
              <items id="comment">Occurrences for this data element are unbounded to allow for clinical scenarios such as removing multiple skin lesions in different places, but where all of the other attributes are identical. Use this data element to record simple terms or precoordinated anatomical locations. If the requirements for recording the anatomical location are determined at run-time by the application or require more complex modelling such as relative locations then use the CLUSTER.anatomical_location or CLUSTER.relative_location within the 'Procedure detail' SLOT in this archetype. If the anatomical location is included in the 'Procedure name' via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant.</items>
              <items id="description">Identification of the body site for the procedure.</items>
              <items id="text">Body site</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0064">
              <items id="comment">For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.</items>
              <items id="description">Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.</items>
              <items id="text">Extension</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0065">
              <items id="comment">Use this data element to record simple terms or a narrative description. If the requirements for recording the method require more complex modelling then this can be represented by additional archetypes within the 'Procedure detail' SLOT in this archetype. If the method is included in the 'Procedure name' via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant.</items>
              <items id="description">Identification of specific method or technique for the procedure.</items>
              <items id="text">Method</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0066">
              <items id="comment">Only for use in association with the 'Procedure scheduled' pathway step.</items>
              <items id="description">The date and/or time on which the procedure is intended to be performed.</items>
              <items id="text">Scheduled date/time</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0067">
              <items id="comment">This pragmatic data element may be used to support organisation within the user interface.</items>
              <items id="description">The type of procedure.</items>
              <items id="text">Procedure type</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0068">
              <items id="description">The procedure, or subprocedure in a multicomponent procedure, has been commenced.</items>
              <items id="text">Procedure commenced</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0069">
              <items id="comment">Examples: The patient was agitated, insufficient emptying of the stomach before gastroscopy, a tumour in the bile ducts made it impossible to pass the scope through.</items>
              <items id="description">Difficulties or issues encountered during performance of the procedure.</items>
              <items id="text">Procedural difficulty</items>
            </term_definitions>
          </children>

request.description:
Implementation Notes

This call allows uploading openEHR operational templates prepared by the openEHR modelling tools.


Response Messages


201  Success.

400  Invalid content (unable to read opt) (TMPL-3602).

401  Unauthenticated - could not authenticate user (SYS-9401).

403  Forbidden - the user does not have the required permissions to execute this request (SYS-9403).

item.name: Get web template - IDCR - Procedures List.v1

request.description:
Resource Url

https://ehrscape.code-4-health.org/rest/v1/template/{templateId}/example
Parameters

Parameter  Value  Description  Parameter Type  Data Type
templateId
required
  The ID of the template to load.  path  string
defaultLanguage
optional
  The default language to generate the web template with.  query  string
languages
optional
  Other languages to include in the web template, separated by a comma.  query  string
format
optional

The format of JSON representation of the example composition to return. Default: FLAT.  query  enum
exampleFilter
optional

The type of example to produce - intended for input (sent to the server), output (received back from the server) etc.  query  enum
Try it out!
Implementation Notes

Returns an example of data values for a ThinkEhr web template.

This method will show all the web template paths that can be filled out in order to successfully save a composition in the web template format. It will do its best to generate legal exampledata values for those paths, taking into account the data type and validation constraints.

Two parameters control the output of this call. The format parameter controls whether the produced output will be the web template composition values in either the FLAT or the STRUCTURED (hierarchical) JSON format. The exampleFilter parameter controls whether the example will show the values as they would be submitted to the server (INPUT) or received from the server (OUTPUT), since the latter one is more detailed.

The two language parameters determine the languages that the web template will be generated with before its example values will be produced and returned. See the documentation for the {templateId} call for more information on web template languages.

Resource Url

https://ehrscape.code-4-health.org/rest/v1/template/{templateId}/example
Parameters

Parameter  Value  Description  Parameter Type  Data Type
templateId
required
  The ID of the template to load.  path  string
defaultLanguage
optional
  The default language to generate the web template with.  query  string
languages
optional
  Other languages to include in the web template, separated by a comma.  query  string
format
optional

The format of JSON representation of the example composition to return. Default: FLAT.  query  enum
exampleFilter
optional

The type of example to produce - intended for input (sent to the server), output (received back from the server) etc.  query  enum

Implementation Notes

This call allows uploading openEHR operational templates prepared by the openEHR modelling tools.

400  Invalid content (unable to read opt) (TMPL-3602).

401  Unauthenticated - could not authenticate user (SYS-9401).

403  Forbidden - the user does not have the required permissions to execute this request (SYS-9403).

request.description:
Implementation Notes

This call allows uploading openEHR operational templates prepared by the openEHR modelling tools.


Response Messages


201  Success.

400  Invalid content (unable to read opt) (TMPL-3602).

401  Unauthenticated - could not authenticate user (SYS-9401).

403  Forbidden - the user does not have the required permissions to execute this request (SYS-9403).

item.name: Commit Composition JSON FLAT - Clinical Notes 1

body.raw:
{
  "ctx/composer_name": "Dr Tony Shannon",
  "ctx/health_care_facility|id": "999999-345",
  "ctx/health_care_facility|name": "Home",
  "ctx/id_namespace": "NHS-UK",
  "ctx/id_scheme": "2.16.840.1.113883.2.1.4.3",
  "ctx/language": "en",
  "ctx/territory": "GB",
  "ctx/time": "2015-03-18T00:11:02.518+02:00",
  "clinical_notes/clinical_synopsis:0/_name|value": "SOAP Note",
   "clinical_notes/clinical_synopsis:0/notes": "S: Patient reports not feeling quite right for several days, breathless, tired and arms and legs feel heavy. Also mild anxiety.\nO: BP 160/96, pulse 99.\nA: possible hypertension, needs further investigation.\nP: usual lab tests and further BP checks"
}

exec: pm.expect(jsonData.resultSet[0].Clinical_note).to.eql("Restless night, urinary frequency, pain on micturition and raised temperature, urine sample to lab, start Amoxicillin and Clavulanate potassium 250mg every 8 hours.");

request.description:
Implementation Notes

This call allows uploading openEHR operational templates prepared by the openEHR modelling tools.


Response Messages


201  Success.

400  Invalid content (unable to read opt) (TMPL-3602).

401  Unauthenticated - could not authenticate user (SYS-9401).

403  Forbidden - the user does not have the required permissions to execute this request (SYS-9403).

                            <term_definitions code="at0000">

                            </term_definitions>
                            <term_definitions code="at0051">
                              <items id="comment">For example '5l/min'.</items>

                              <items id="text">Oxygen flow rate</items>
                            </term_definitions>
                            <term_definitions code="at0052">

                            </term_definitions>
                            <term_definitions code="at0053">

                            </term_definitions>
                            <term_definitions code="at0054">
                              <items id="comment">Intended to capture only simple description / terms, for example: 'nasal prongs'. The 'Oxygen delivery detail' slot may be used for more detailed or complex recording.  </items>
                              <items id="description">The method used to delivery the oxygen.</items>
                              <items id="text">Method of oxygen delivery</items>
                            </term_definitions>
                            <term_definitions code="at0057">
                              <items id="comment">Where 'On air' is set to true, Oxygen flow rate, FiO2 and Percent O2 should not be recorded. Conversely 'On air'should omitted if Oxygen flow rate, FiO2 or Percent O2 are recorded.</items>
                              <items id="description">The patient is receiving air, equivalent to 21% O2, 0.21 FiO2 and an oxygen flow rate  of 0.</items>
                              <items id="text">On air</items>
                            </term_definitions>
                            <term_definitions code="at0058">
                              <items id="comment">For example, details of assisted ventilation (CPAP etc), tubing, humidification.</items>
                              <items id="description">Further details of the method of oxygen delivery.</items>
                              <items id="text">Oxygen delivery detail</items>
                            </term_definitions>

            <archetype_id>
              <value>openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.respiration.v1</value>
            </archetype_id>
            <term_definitions code="at0000">
              <items id="description">The observed characteristics of spontaneous breathing as would commonly be recorded as part of a 'vital signs' examination.</items>
              <items id="text">Respirations</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0001">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">history</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0002">
              <items id="description">Generic event.</items>
              <items id="text">Any event</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0003">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">List</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0004">
              <items id="description">Rate of respiration.</items>
              <items id="text">Rate</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0005">
              <items id="description">Rhythm of respiration.</items>
              <items id="text">Rhythm</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0006">
              <items id="description">Regular respiration.</items>
              <items id="text">Regular</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0007">
              <items id="description">Irregular respirations.</items>
              <items id="text">Irregular</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0009">
              <items id="description">Specific abnormal respiratory pattern. Other patterns may be entered as free text or terminology subset defined at specialisation or template level.</items>
              <items id="text">Abnormal respiratory pattern</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0012">
              <items id="description">Deep chest breathing with or without a visible gasp.</items>
              <items id="text">Kussmaul's respiration</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0016">
              <items id="description">Depth of respiration.</items>
              <items id="text">Depth</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0017">
              <items id="description">Normal depth of breathing.</items>
              <items id="text">Normal</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0018">
              <items id="description">Shallow depth of breathing.</items>
              <items id="text">Shallow</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0019">
              <items id="description">Deep breathing.</items>
              <items id="text">Deep</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0022">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">List</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0024">
              <items id="description">A text description of respirations.</items>
              <items id="text">Description</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0025">
              <items id="description">Variable depth of breathing.</items>
              <items id="text">Variable</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0030">
              <items id="description">Periods of hyperventilation alternating with periods of apnoea.</items>
              <items id="text">Cheyne-Stokes respiration</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0031">
              <items id="description">Breathing of varying tidal volumes and rates.</items>
              <items id="text">Ataxic respiration</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0033">
              <items id="description">Deep, gasping inspiration with a pause at full inspiration followed by a brief, insufficient release of breath.</items>
              <items id="text">Apneustic respiration</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0034">
              <items id="description">Clusters of irregular breaths that alternate with periods of apnoea. Also termed Biot's breathing.</items>
              <items id="text">Cluster breathing</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0037">
              <items id="description">Subject's level of exertion at or just prior to the observation being made. Intended only to record exertion only as it might effect respirations and where it would not normally be recorded as part of general clinical observation.</items>
              <items id="text">Exertion</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0044">
              <items id="description">Breathing has ceased.</items>
              <items id="text">Apnoea</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0054">
              <items id="description">The respiratory expiratory phase is longer than normal/usual. Associated with obstructive airways disease such as asthma.</items>
              <items id="text">Prolonged expiratory phase</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0055">
              <items id="description">Details of the amount of oxygen being delivered to the subject at the time of observation.  Assumed values of 21% oxygen concentration, Fi02 of 0.21 and oxygen flow rate of 0 l/min or 0 ml/min.</items>
              <items id="text">Ambient oxygen</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0056">
              <items id="description">Comment on and record other incidental factors that may be contributing to the respirations observation. For example, level of anxiety, pain, feeding in infants, tracheostomy.</items>
              <items id="text">Confounding factors</items>
            </term_definitions>
          </children>

            <archetype_id>
              <value>openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.pulse.v1</value>
            </archetype_id>
            <term_definitions code="at0000">
              <items id="description">Record details about the rate and associated attributes for a pulse or heart beat.</items>
              <items id="text">Pulse/Heart beat</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0001">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">structure</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0002">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">history</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0003">
              <items id="description">Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.</items>
              <items id="text">Any event</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0004">
              <items id="comment">Run-time name constraints have been specified, in order to simplify the renaming of this data element to Pulse Rate or Heart Rate, as required.</items>
              <items id="description">The rate, measured in beats per minute.</items>
              <items id="text">Rate</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0005">
              <items id="description">Is the pulse or heart beat regular?</items>
              <items id="text">Regular?</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0006">
              <items id="description">The pattern is regular.</items>
              <items id="text">Regular</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0007">
              <items id="description">The pattern is irregular in a regular pattern,. For example, a dropped beat once every 'n' beats.</items>
              <items id="text">Regularly Irregular</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0008">
              <items id="description">The pattern is irregular in a chaotic and unpredictable manner. For example, atrial fibrillation.</items>
              <items id="text">Irregularly Irregular</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0010">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">List</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0012">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">List</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0013">
              <items id="description">The body position of the subject during the observation.</items>
              <items id="text">Position</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1000">
              <items id="description">The subject was lying flat.</items>
              <items id="text">Lying</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1001">
              <items id="description">The subject was sitting (for example on bed or chair).</items>
              <items id="text">Sitting</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1002">
              <items id="description">The subject was reclining at an approximate angle of 45 degrees, with the legs elevated to the level of the pelvis.</items>
              <items id="text">Reclining</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1003">
              <items id="description">The subject was standing, walking or running.</items>
              <items id="text">Standing/upright</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1005">
              <items id="comment">It can be implied that the pulse is present if Rate >0 beats/min.</items>
              <items id="description">Presence of a pulse or heart beat.</items>
              <items id="text">Presence</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1013">
              <items id="description">Details about the device used to measure the pulse rate or heart rate.</items>
              <items id="text">Device</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1017">
              <items id="description">Details about physical exertion being undertaken during the examination.</items>
              <items id="text">Exertion</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1018">
              <items id="comment">For example, presence of a pacemaker, level of anxiety; pain or fever etc.</items>
              <items id="description">Narrative description about any incidental factors that may affect interpretation of the physical findings.</items>
              <items id="text">Confounding factors</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1019">
              <items id="comment">For example, auscultation or electronic monitoring. </items>
              <items id="description">Method used to observe the pulse or heart beat.</items>
              <items id="text">Method</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1022">
              <items id="description">Narrative description about the pulse or heart beat.</items>
              <items id="text">Clinical description</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1023">
              <items id="comment">Coding with a terminology is preferred, where possible. For example: Bradycardia, Extrasystoles or Sinus rhythm. Multiple statements are allowed. </items>
              <items id="description">Single word, phrase or brief description that represents the clinical meaning and significance of the pulse or heart beat findings, including the rhythm.</items>
              <items id="text">Clinical interpretation</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1024">
              <items id="description">A pulse or heart beat can be detected.</items>
              <items id="text">Present</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1025">
              <items id="description">A pulse or heart beat cannot be detected.</items>
              <items id="text">Not detected</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1026">
              <items id="description">The pulse rate, measured in beats per minute.</items>
              <items id="text">Pulse Rate</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1027">
              <items id="description">The heart rate, measured in beats per minute.</items>
              <items id="text">Heart Rate</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1028">
              <items id="description">The pattern is irregular.</items>
              <items id="text">Irregular</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1030">
              <items id="comment">Coding with a terminology is desired, where possible. For example: full, thready, bounding, slow rising, or collapsing. Multiple terms may be recorded.</items>
              <items id="description">Description of the character of the pulse or heart beat.</items>
              <items id="text">Character</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1032">
              <items id="description">The findings are observed by physical touch of the observer on the subject.</items>
              <items id="text">Palpation</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1033">
              <items id="description">The findings are observed with the assistance of a device, such as a stethoscope.</items>
              <items id="text">Auscultation</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1034">
              <items id="description">The findings are observed non-invasively using a device such as a pulse oximeter or a stethoscope.</items>
              <items id="text">Automatic, non-invasive</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1036">
              <items id="description">Maximum pulse rate or heart rate observed during a period of exertion.</items>
              <items id="text">Maximum</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1037">
              <items id="description">Body site where the pulse or heart beat were observed.</items>
              <items id="text">Body site</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1038">
              <items id="description">The left radial artery.</items>
              <items id="text">Radial Artery - Left</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1039">
              <items id="description">The right radial artery.</items>
              <items id="text">Radial Artery - Right</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1040">
              <items id="description">The region of the heart.</items>
              <items id="text">Heart</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1041">
              <items id="description">The left carotid artery.</items>
              <items id="text">Carotid Artery - Left</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1042">
              <items id="description">The right carotid artery.</items>
              <items id="text">Carotid Artery - Right</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1043">
              <items id="description">The left femoral artery.</items>
              <items id="text">Femoral Artery - Left</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1044">
              <items id="description">The right femoral artery.</items>
              <items id="text">Femoral Artery - Right</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1045">
              <items id="description">Presence of a pulse.</items>
              <items id="text">Pulse presence</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1046">
              <items id="description">Presence of a heart beat.</items>
              <items id="text">Heart beat presence</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1047">
              <items id="description">An unspecified finger.</items>
              <items id="text">Finger</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1048">
              <items id="description">The left brachial artery.</items>
              <items id="text">Brachial artery - Left</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1049">
              <items id="description">The right brachial artery.</items>
              <items id="text">Brachial artery - Right</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1050">
              <items id="description">The findings are observed invasively using a device such as an arterial catheter.</items>
              <items id="text">Automatic, invasive</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1051">
              <items id="description">The lobe of an unspecified ear.</items>
              <items id="text">Ear lobe</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1054">
              <items id="description">An unspecified toe.</items>
              <items id="text">Toe</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1055">
              <items id="comment">Selection of a value from this value set is only valid if 'Irregular' is selected from the 'Regularity' data element.</items>
              <items id="description">More specific pattern of an irregular pulse or heart beat.</items>
              <items id="text">Irregular type</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1056">
              <items id="comment">For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.</items>
              <items id="description">Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.</items>
              <items id="text">Extension</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1057">
              <items id="description">Generic label to allow for any or all statements about the pulse or heart beat.</items>
              <items id="text">Clinical interpretation</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1058">
              <items id="description">Specific conclusion about the rhythm of the pulse or heartbeat, drawn from a combination of the heart rate, pattern and other characteristics observed on examination.</items>
              <items id="text">Rhythm</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1059">
              <items id="description">Additional narrative about the pulse or heart beat findings not captured in other fields.</items>
              <items id="text">Comment</items>
            </term_definitions>
          </children>

            <term_definitions code="at0000">
              <items id="description">A measurement of the body temperature, which is a surrogate for the whole body temperature of the person.</items>
              <items id="text">Body temperature</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0001">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">Tree</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0002">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">History</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0003">
              <items id="description">Any event.</items>
              <items id="text">Any event</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0004">
              <items id="description">The measured body temperature (as a surrogate for the whole body).</items>
              <items id="text">Temperature</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0020">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">Protocol</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0021">
              <items id="description">The anatomical site of measurement of the temperature.</items>
              <items id="text">Site of measurement</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0022">
              <items id="description">Temperature is measured within the mouth.</items>
              <items id="text">Mouth</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0023">
              <items id="description">Temperature is measured from within the external auditory canal.</items>
              <items id="text">Ear canal</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0024">
              <items id="description">Temperature is measured from the skin of the axilla with the arm positioned down by the side.</items>
              <items id="text">Axilla</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0025">
              <items id="description">Temperature measured within the rectum.</items>
              <items id="text">Rectum</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0026">
              <items id="description">Temperature is measured within the nasopharynx.</items>
              <items id="text">Nasopharynx</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0027">
              <items id="description">Temperature is measured in the urinary bladder.</items>
              <items id="text">Urinary bladder</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0028">
              <items id="description">Temperature is measured within the vascular system.</items>
              <items id="text">Intravascular</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0029">
              <items id="description">State information about the patient.</items>
              <items id="text">State</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0030">
              <items id="description">The thermal situation of the person who is having the temperature taken.</items>
              <items id="text">Body exposure</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0031">
              <items id="description">No clothing, bedding or covering.</items>
              <items id="text">Naked</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0032">
              <items id="description">The person is covered by a lesser amount of clothing or bedding than deemed appropriate for the environmental circumstances.</items>
              <items id="text">Reduced clothing/bedding</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0033">
              <items id="description">The person is covered by an amount of clothing or bedding deemed appropriate for the environmental circumstances.</items>
              <items id="text">Appropriate clothing/bedding</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0034">
              <items id="description">The person is covered by an increased amount of clothing or bedding than deemed appropriate for the environmental circumstances.</items>
              <items id="text">Increased clothing/bedding</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0041">
              <items id="description">Description of the conditions applied to the subject that might influence their measured body temperature.</items>
              <items id="text">Description of thermal stress</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0043">
              <items id="description">Temperature is measured from exposed skin.</items>
              <items id="text">Skin</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0051">
              <items id="description">Temperature is measured within the vagina.</items>
              <items id="text">Vagina</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0054">
              <items id="description">Temperatue is measured within the oesophagus.</items>
              <items id="text">Oesophagus</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0055">
              <items id="description">Temperature is measured in the inguinal skin crease between the leg and abdominal wall.</items>
              <items id="text">Inguinal skin crease</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0056">
              <items id="description">Details about the environmental conditions at the time of temperature measurement.</items>
              <items id="text">Environmental Conditions</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0057">
              <items id="description">Details about the exertion of the person at the time of temperature measurement.</items>
              <items id="text">Exertion</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0058">
              <items id="description">Details about the menstrual cycle of a woman.</items>
