            <archetype_id>
              <value>openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.blood_pressure.v1</value>
            </archetype_id>
            <term_definitions code="at0000">
              <items id="description">The local measurement of arterial blood pressure which is a surrogate for arterial pressure in the systemic circulation.  Most commonly, use of the term 'blood pressure' refers to measurement of brachial artery pressure in the upper arm.</items>
              <items id="text">Blood Pressure</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0001">
              <items id="description">History Structural node.</items>
              <items id="text">history</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0003">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">blood pressure</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0004">
              <items id="description">Peak systemic arterial blood pressure  - measured in systolic or contraction phase of the heart cycle.</items>
              <items id="text">Systolic</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0005">
              <items id="description">Minimum systemic arterial blood pressure - measured in the diastolic or relaxation phase of the heart cycle.</items>
              <items id="text">Diastolic</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0006">
              <items id="description">Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.</items>
              <items id="text">Any event</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0007">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">state structure</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0008">
              <items id="description">The position of the subject at the time of measurement.</items>
              <items id="text">Position</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0011">
              <items id="description">List structure.</items>
              <items id="text">Tree</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0013">
              <items id="comment">Perloff D, Grim C, Flack J, Frohlich ED, Hill M, McDonald M, Morgenstern BZ. Human blood pressure determination by sphygmomanometry. Circulation 1993;88;2460-2470. </items>
              <items id="description">The size of the cuff used for blood pressure measurement.</items>
              <items id="text">Cuff size</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0014">
              <items id="description">Simple body site where blood pressure was measured.</items>
              <items id="text">Location of measurement</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0015">
              <items id="description">A cuff used for an adult thigh.</items>
              <items id="text">Adult Thigh</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0016">
              <items id="description">A cuff for adults with larger arms.</items>
              <items id="text">Large Adult</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0017">
              <items id="description">A cuff that is standard for an adult.</items>
              <items id="text">Adult</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0025">
              <items id="description">The right arm of the person.</items>
              <items id="text">Right arm</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0026">
              <items id="description">The left arm of the person.</items>
              <items id="text">Left arm</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0027">
              <items id="description">The right thigh of the person.</items>
              <items id="text">Right thigh</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0028">
              <items id="description">The left thigh of the person.</items>
              <items id="text">Left thigh</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0033">
              <items id="description">Additional narrative about the measurement, not captured in other fields.</items>
              <items id="text">Comment</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1000">
              <items id="description">Standing at the time of blood pressure measurement.</items>
              <items id="text">Standing</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1001">
              <items id="description">Sitting (for example on bed or chair) at the time of blood pressure measurement.</items>
              <items id="text">Sitting</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1002">
              <items id="description">Reclining at the time of blood pressure measurement.</items>
              <items id="text">Reclining</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1003">
              <items id="description">Lying flat at the time of blood pressure measurement.</items>
              <items id="text">Lying</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1005">
              <items id="comment">PLEASE NOTE: '°' is a valid UCUM unit. Please use 'deg' as the correct unit.</items>
              <items id="description">The craniocaudal tilt of the surface on which the person is lying at the time of measurement.</items>
              <items id="text">Tilt</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1006">
              <items id="description">The average arterial pressure that occurs over the entire course of the heart contraction and relaxation cycle.</items>
              <items id="text">Mean arterial pressure</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1007">
              <items id="description">The difference between the systolic and diastolic pressure.</items>
              <items id="text">Pulse pressure</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1008">
              <items id="description">A cuff used for a small adult.</items>
              <items id="text">Small Adult</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1009">
              <items id="description">A cuff that is appropriate for a child or adult with a thin arm.</items>
              <items id="text">Paediatric/Child</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1010">
              <items id="description">Record which Korotkoff sound is used for determining diastolic pressure using auscultative method.</items>
              <items id="text">Diastolic endpoint</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1011">
              <items id="description">The fourth Korotkoff sound is identified as an abrupt muffling of sounds.</items>
              <items id="text">Phase IV</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1012">
              <items id="description">The fifth Korotkoff sound is identified by absence of sounds as the cuff pressure drops below the diastolic blood pressure.</items>
              <items id="text">Phase V</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1014">
              <items id="description">Lying flat with some lateral tilt, usually angled towards the left side.   Commonly required in the last trimester of pregnancy to relieve aortocaval compression.</items>
              <items id="text">Lying with tilt to left</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1018">
              <items id="description">A cuff used for infants.</items>
              <items id="text">Infant</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1019">
              <items id="description">A cuff used for a neonate, assuming cuff is the appropriate size for maturity and birthweight of the neonate.</items>
              <items id="text">Neonatal</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1020">
              <items id="description">The right wrist of the subject.</items>
              <items id="text">Right wrist</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1021">
              <items id="description">The left wrist of the subject.</items>
              <items id="text">Left wrist</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1025">
              <items id="description">Details about sphygmomanometer or other device used to measure the blood pressure.</items>
              <items id="text">Device</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1026">
              <items id="description">The right ankle of the subject.</items>
              <items id="text">Right ankle</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1030">
              <items id="description">Details about physical activity undertaken at the time of blood pressure measurement.</items>
              <items id="text">Exertion</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1031">
              <items id="description">The left ankle of the subject.</items>
              <items id="text">Left ankle</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1032">
              <items id="description">A finger of the subject.</items>
              <items id="text">Finger</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1033">
              <items id="comment">Use 'Location of measurement' to select from a value set of common sites or free text choice.  Use SLOT for 'Structured measurement location' to record unusual sites, such as intra-arterial catheter sites. 'Specific location' has been deprecated.</items>
              <items id="description">Body location where blood pressure is measured.</items>
              <items id="text">Location</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1034">
              <items id="description">Data element deprecated, and replaced by free text component of 'Location of measurement' data type.</items>
              <items id="text">X - Specific location</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1035">
              <items id="description">Method of measurement of blood pressure.</items>
              <items id="text">Method</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1036">
              <items id="description">Method of measuring blood pressure externally, using a stethoscope and Korotkoff sounds.</items>
              <items id="text">Auscultation</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1037">
              <items id="description">Method of measuring blood pressure externally, using palpation (usually of the brachial or radial arteries).</items>
              <items id="text">Palpation</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1038">
              <items id="description">Formula used to calculate the Mean Arterial Pressure (if recorded in data).</items>
              <items id="text">Mean arterial pressure formula</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1039">
              <items id="description">Method of measuring blood pressure externally, using a blood pressure machine.</items>
              <items id="text">Machine</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1040">
              <items id="description">Method of measuring blood pressure internally ie involving penetration of the skin and measuring inside blood vessels.</items>
              <items id="text">Invasive</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1042">
              <items id="description">Estimate of the average blood pressure over a 24 hour period.</items>
              <items id="text">24 hour average</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1043">
              <items id="description">Sleep status - supports interpretation of 24 hour ambulatory blood pressure records.</items>
              <items id="text">Sleep status</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1044">
              <items id="description">Subject is fully conscious.</items>
              <items id="text">Alert & awake</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1045">
              <items id="description">Subject is in the natural state of bodily rest.</items>
              <items id="text">Sleeping</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1051">
              <items id="description">A toe of the subject.</items>
              <items id="text">Toe</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1052">
              <items id="description">Comment on and record other incidental factors that may be contributing to the blood pressure measurement.  For example, level of anxiety or 'white coat syndrome'; pain or fever; changes in atmospheric pressure etc.</items>
              <items id="text">Confounding factors</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1053">
              <items id="description">Invasive measurement via transducer access line within an artery.</items>
              <items id="text">Intra-arterial</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1054">
              <items id="description">Formula used to calculate the systolic pressure from from mean arterial pressure (if recorded in data).</items>
              <items id="text">Systolic pressure formula</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1055">
              <items id="description">Formula used to calculate the diastolic pressure from mean arterial pressure (if recorded in data).</items>
              <items id="text">Diastolic pressure formula</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1057">
              <items id="description">Structured anatomical location of where the measurement was taken.</items>
              <items id="text">Structured measurement location</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1058">
              <items id="comment">For example: Local hospital departmental infomation or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.</items>
              <items id="description">Additional information required to capture local context or to align with other reference models/formalisms.</items>
              <items id="text">Extension</items>
            </term_definitions>

            <archetype_id>
              <value>openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.indirect_oximetry.v1</value>
            </archetype_id>
            <term_definitions code="at0000">
              <items id="description">Method of monitoring blood gas measurements such as Spo2 and pTCO2 by indirect, currently non-invasive, means.</items>
              <items id="text">Indirect Oximetry</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0001">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">Event Series</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0002">
              <items id="description">Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.</items>
              <items id="text">Any Event</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0003">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">Tree</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0006">
              <items id="comment">spO2 is defined as the ratio of oxyhaemoglobin (HbO2) to the total concentration of haemoglobin (HbO2 + deoxyhaemoglobin).</items>
              <items id="description">Measured via pulse oximetry, the saturation of oxygen in the peripheral blood.</items>
              <items id="text">spO2</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0007">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">List</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0009">
              <items id="description">The site of the measurement sensor.</items>
              <items id="text">Sensor Site</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0014">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">Tree</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0015">
              <items id="description">Details of the amount of oxygen available to the subject at the time of observation.  Assumed values of 21% oxygen concentration, Fi02 of 0.21 and oxygen flow rate of 0 l/min or 0 ml/min.</items>
              <items id="text">Ambient Oxygen</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0016">
              <items id="description">Comment on and record other incidental factors that may be affect interpretation of the observation. For example, motion, pain, poor perfusion, infant feeding.</items>
              <items id="text">Confounding Factors</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0018">
              <items id="description">Details of the non-invasive oximetry device used.</items>
              <items id="text">Oximetry Device</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0019">
              <items id="description">Details of a series of oximetry readings, other than waveforms, expressed as a multimedia image or series of images. Waveforms should be recorded using the Waveform slot and associated cluster archetype.</items>
              <items id="text">Multimedia Image</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0020">
              <items id="comment">For example: transmittal electrode; reflective electrode; clamp electrode; or strip electrode.</items>
              <items id="description">The type of measurement sensor used.</items>
              <items id="text">Sensor Type</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0034">
              <items id="description">Details about physical activity undertaken at the time of measurement.</items>
              <items id="text">Exertion</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0036">
              <items id="description">A text comment about the indirect oximetry result.</items>
              <items id="text">Comment</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0037">
              <items id="description">The operating temperature of a transcutaneous oximeter electrode.</items>
              <items id="text">Electrode Operating Temperature</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0038">
              <items id="description">The date and time at which the sensor was applied. Significant for transcutaneous oximetry.</items>
              <items id="text">Time of Sensor Application</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0039">
              <items id="description">Measured via transcutaneous electrode oximetry, the partial pressure of oxygen in the peripheral blood.</items>
              <items id="text">ptcO2</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0040">
              <items id="description">Measured via transcutaneous electrode oximetry, the partial pressure of carbon dioxide in the peripheral blood.</items>
              <items id="text">ptcCO2</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0044">
              <items id="description">Measured via pulse CO-oximetry, the oxygen content of the peripheral blood.</items>
              <items id="text">spOC</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0045">
              <items id="description">Measured via pulse CO-oximetry, the saturation of carboxyhaemoglobin in the perpiheral blood.</items>
              <items id="text">spCO</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0046">
              <items id="description">Measured via pulse CO-oximetry, the saturation of methoxyhaemoglobin in the peripheral blood.</items>
              <items id="text">spMet</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0048">
              <items id="description">A pulse oximetry transmittal sensor was applied.</items>
              <items id="text">Transmittal</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0049">
              <items id="description">A pulse oximetry reflective sensor was applied.</items>
              <items id="text">Reflective</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0050">
              <items id="description">A pulse oximetry clamp sensor was applied.</items>
              <items id="text">Clamp</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0051">
              <items id="description">A pulse oximetry strip sensor was applied.</items>
              <items id="text">Strip</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0052">
              <items id="description">A transcutaneous electrode sensor was applied.</items>
              <items id="text">Electrode</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0054">
              <items id="description">A waveform reading associated with the oximetry measurement.</items>
              <items id="text">Waveform</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0056">
              <items id="description">Details of the oxygen delivery device used.</items>
              <items id="text">Oxygen Delivery Device</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0057">
              <items id="comment">For example: nasal cannulae; Venturi mask; non-rebreathing mask with reservoir; or ventilator.</items>
              <items id="description">Method of oxygen delivery device used to supply supplemental oxygen.</items>
              <items id="text">Method of Oxygen Delivery</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0058">
              <items id="comment">Coding with a terminology is preferred, if possible. For example, normal oxygen saturation or hypoxaemia.</items>
              <items id="description">Single word, phrase or brief description represents the clinical meaning and significance of the physical examination findings.</items>
              <items id="text">Interpretation</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0059">
              <items id="comment">e.g. Local hospital departmental infomation or additional metadata to align with HL7 or CDISC equivalents.</items>
              <items id="description">Additional information required to capture local context or to align with other reference models/formalisms.</items>
              <items id="text">Extension</items>
            </term_definitions>

            <archetype_id>
              <value>openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.news_uk_rcp.v1</value>
            </archetype_id>
            <term_definitions code="at0000">
              <items id="description">NEWS (National Early Warning Score) is a simple score used to provide an objective indication of a patient's degree of clinical deterioration. This version follows guidance issued by the UK Royal College of Physicians.</items>
              <items id="text">NEWS (UK RCP)</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0001">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">Event Series</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0002">
              <items id="description">A specific date and/or time which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.</items>
              <items id="text">Point in time</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0003">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">Tree</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0004">
              <items id="description">Range category for the systolic blood pressure (SBP) measurement of a patient.</items>
              <items id="text">Systolic blood pressure</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0005">
              <items id="description">Range category for the heart rate (HR) measurement of a patient.</items>
              <items id="text">Heart rate</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0006">
              <items id="description">Range category for the respiratory rate (RR) measurement of a patient.</items>
              <items id="text">Respiration rate</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0007">
              <items id="description">Range category for the body temperature (Temp) measurement of a patient.</items>
              <items id="text">Body temperature</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0008">
              <items id="description">Observed category for the AVPU scale rating of a patient's conscious state.</items>
              <items id="text">Level of consciousness</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0010">
              <items id="description">The heart rate measurement is less than/equal to 40 beats/min or greater than/equal to 131 beats/min; scored as 3 points.</items>
              <items id="text"><=40 or >=131</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0011">
              <items id="description">The heart rate measurement is between 111 and 130 beats/min; scored as 2 points.</items>
              <items id="text">111-130</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0012">
              <items id="description">The heart rate measurement is between 41 and 50 beats/min or between 91 and 110 beats/min; scored as 1 point.</items>
              <items id="text">41-50 or 91-110</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0013">
              <items id="description">The heart rate measurement is between 51 and 90 beats/min; scored as 0 points.</items>
              <items id="text">51-90</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0014">
              <items id="description">The systolic blood pressure measurement is between 111 and 219 mmHg; scored as 0 points.</items>
              <items id="text">111-219</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0015">
              <items id="description">The systolic blood pressure measurement is between 101 and 110 mmHg; scored as 1 point.</items>
              <items id="text">101-110</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0016">
              <items id="description">The systolic blood pressure measurement is between 91 and 100 mmHg; scored as 2 points.</items>
              <items id="text">91-100</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0017">
              <items id="description">The systolic blood pressure measurement is less than/equal to 90 mmHg or greater than/equal to 220 mmHg; scored as 3 points.</items>
              <items id="text"><=90 or >= 220</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0018">
              <items id="description">The respiratory rate measurement is between 12 and 20 breaths/min; scored as 0 points.</items>
              <items id="text">12-20</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0019">
              <items id="description">The respiratory rate measurement is between 9 and 11 breaths/min; scored as 1 point.</items>
              <items id="text">9-11</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0020">
              <items id="description">The respiratory rate measurement is between 21 and 24 breaths/min; scored as 2 points.</items>
              <items id="text">21-24</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0021">
              <items id="description">The respiratory rate measurement is less than/equal to 8 breaths/min or greater than/equal to 25 breaths/min; scored as 3 points.</items>
              <items id="text"><=8 or >=25</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0022">
              <items id="description">The body temperature measurement is between 36.1 and 38.0 degrees Celsius; scored as 0 points.</items>
              <items id="text">36.1-38.0</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0023">
              <items id="description">The body temperature measurement is between 35.1 and 36.0 degrees Celsius or between 38.1 and 39.0 degrees Celsius; scored as 1 point.</items>
              <items id="text">35.1-36.0 or 38.1-39.0</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0024">
              <items id="description">The patient is alert or awake; scored as 0 points.</items>
              <items id="text">A</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0025">
              <items id="description">The patient responds only to verbal, pain or stimulus; scored as 3 points.</items>
              <items id="text">V, P or U</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0028">
              <items id="comment">Total score may be generated at run-time.</items>
              <items id="description">The total sum of all the NEWS parameter ordinals.</items>
              <items id="text">Total score</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0029">
              <items id="description">Range category for the oxygen saturation measurement of a patient.</items>
              <items id="text">Oxygen saturation</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0030">
              <items id="description">The oxygen saturation level is greater than/equal to 96%;scored as 0 points.</items>
              <items id="text">>= 96</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0031">
              <items id="description">The oxygen saturation level is between 94% and 95%; scored as 1 point.</items>
              <items id="text">94-95</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0032">
              <items id="description">The oxygen saturation level is between 92% and 93%; scored as 2 points.</items>
              <items id="text">92-93</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0033">
              <items id="description">The oxygen saturation level is less than/equal to 91%; scored as 3 points.</items>
              <items id="text"><=91</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0034">
              <items id="description">Range category depending on whether the patient is receiving supplemental oxygen.</items>
              <items id="text">Supplemental oxygen</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0036">
              <items id="description">The patient is not receiving supplemental oxygen; scored as 0 points.</items>
              <items id="text">No</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0037">
              <items id="description">The patient is receiving supplemental oxygen; scored as 2 points.</items>
              <items id="text">Yes</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0038">
              <items id="description">The body temperature is greater than/equal to 39.1 degrees Celcius; scored as 2 points.</items>
              <items id="text">>=39.1</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0039">
              <items id="description">The body temperature is less than/equal to 35 degrees Celcius ; scored as 3 points.</items>
              <items id="text"><=35.0</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0041">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">Tree</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0043">
              <items id="comment">For example: If the patient has COPD.</items>
              <items id="description">Description of any incidental factors that may have contributed to the score.</items>
              <items id="text">Confounding factors</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0044">
              <items id="description">Additional narrative about the overall NEWS score not captured in other fields.</items>
              <items id="text">Comment</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0045">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">Tree</items>
            </term_definitions>

              <items id="description">Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.</items>
              <items id="text">Extension</items>
            </term_definitions>

                    <term_definitions code="at0000">
                      <items id="description">To record details of a laboratory specimen.</items>
                      <items id="text">Specimen</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0001">
                      <items id="comment">Sometimes called the Accession Identifier.</items>
                      <items id="description">Unique identifier of the specimen, normally assigned by the laboratory.</items>
                      <items id="fhir_mapping">Specimen.accessionIdentifier</items>
                      <items id="text">Laboratory specimen identifier</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0003">
                      <items id="description">Unique identifier of the parent specimen, where the specimen is split into sub-samples.</items>
                      <items id="text">Parent specimen identifier</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0005">
                      <items id="description">Any risk or biohazard associated with collecting or handling the specimen.</items>
                      <items id="text">Potential risk</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0007">
                      <items id="description">The method of collection to be used eg Venepuncture, biopsy, resection.</items>
                      <items id="fhir_mapping">Specimen.collection.method</items>
                      <items id="text">Collection method</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0008">
                      <items id="comment"> e.g. fasting, 'full bladder', 'sterile field' or any special instructions on the handling or immediate processing of the sample e.g. centrifuge on receipt. 

Can also be used to document any known deviations from collection or handling instructions e.g patient was not fasted.</items>
                      <items id="description">Any conditions to be met before the sample should be taken.</items>
                      <items id="text">Sampling conditions</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0013">
                      <items id="description">The anatomical site(s) from where the specimen was taken.</items>
                      <items id="fhir_mapping">Specimen.collection.sourceSite</items>
                      <items id="text">Source site</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0015">
                      <items id="description">The date and time that collection has been ordered to take place or has taken place.</items>
                      <items id="text">Datetime collected</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0027">
                      <items id="description">Dimensions / weight / quantity of sample or other physical details of a bodily fluid. Set as unbounded to allow variations e.g Weight of prostatic gland with and without seminal vesicles.</items>
                      <items id="fhir_mappings">Specimen.collection.quantity</items>
                      <items id="text">Physical properties</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0029">
                      <items id="description">The type of specimen to be collected e.g venous blood, prostatic biopsy.</items>
                      <items id="fhir_mapping">Specimen.type</items>
                      <items id="text">Specimen type</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0034">
                      <items id="description">The date and time that the sample was received at the laboratory.</items>
                      <items id="fhir_mapping">Specimen.receivedTime</items>
                      <items id="text">Datetime received</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0039">
                      <items id="description">Problems with the received specimen.</items>
                      <items id="text">Specimen quality</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0041">
                      <items id="description">Is the specimen adequate for testing?</items>
                      <items id="text">Adequacy for testing</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0042">
                      <items id="description">Specific issue with a received specimen.</items>
                      <items id="text">Specimen received issues</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0044">
                      <items id="description">Issue arising with handling or processing of the specimen within the laboratory.</items>
                      <items id="text">Laboratory handling issues</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0045">
                      <items id="description">An additional text comment on the quality of the received specimen.</items>
                      <items id="text">Comment</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0046">
                      <items id="description">Workflow of specimen processing/handling.</items>
                      <items id="text">Processing</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0052">
                      <items id="description">The specimen was haemolysed.</items>
                      <items id="text">Haemolysed</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0053">
                      <items id="description">The specimen was lipaemic.</items>
                      <items id="text">Lipaemic</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0054">
                      <items id="description">An incorrect preservative was used when transporting the specimen.</items>
                      <items id="text">Incorrect transport medium</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0055">
                      <items id="description">An insufficient sample was given to undertake measurement.</items>
                      <items id="text">Insufficient sample</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0056">
                      <items id="description">An error arose when handling the specimen.</items>
                      <items id="text">Handling error</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0057">
                      <items id="description">The specimen was too old to analyse accurately.</items>
                      <items id="text">Age</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0058">
                      <items id="description">An accident occurred with the sample in the laboratory.</items>
                      <items id="text">Laboratory accident</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0059">
                      <items id="description">The specimen could not be analysed for technical reasons.</items>
                      <items id="text">Technical failure</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0062">
                      <items id="description">The specimen is of sufficient quality to allow reporting.</items>
                      <items id="text">Satisfactory</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0063">
                      <items id="description">The specimen is unsatisfactory but has been processed.</items>
                      <items id="text">Unsatisfactory - processed</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0064">
                      <items id="description">The specimen is unsatisfactory and has not been processed.</items>
                      <items id="text">Unsatisfactory - not processed</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0067">
                      <items id="comment">This specifies the specimen collection location within the healthcare
environment. It enables the laboratory to ask questions about the
collection of the specimen, if required. The specimen collection
setting may provide additional information relevant to the analysis 
of the result.</items>
                      <items id="description">Identification of the setting at which the specimen was collected 
from a subject of care. The specimen is often collected by a 
healthcare provider, but may be collected directly by the patient or carer at home.</items>
                      <items id="text">Collection setting</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0068">
                      <items id="description">The specimen preparation cluster allows detailed recording of a particular preparation step e.g staining or fixation.</items>
                      <items id="text">Processing details</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0070">
                      <items id="description">Identifier of the person or agency responsible for collecting the specimen.</items>
                      <items id="fhir_mapping">Specimen.collection.collector</items>
                      <items id="text">Specimen collector identifier</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0071">
                      <items id="description">The person or organisation responsible for collecting the specimen.</items>
                      <items id="fhir_mapping">Specimen.collection.collector</items>
                      <items id="text">Specimen collector details</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0079">
                      <items id="description">Additional detailed description of method of sample collection.</items>
                      <items id="text">Collection method description</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0080">
                      <items id="description">The total number of containers holding this specimen.</items>
                      <items id="text">Number of containers</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0081">
                      <items id="description">Details of a related specimen.</items>
                      <items id="text">Related specimen</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0083">
                      <items id="description">Addtional details related to specific collection methods e.g. needle biopsy.</items>
                      <items id="text">Additional collection details</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0085">
                      <items id="description">Details of container(s) used.</items>
                      <items id="text">Container details</items>
                    </term_definitions>

        <term_definitions code="at0000">
          <items id="description">Clinical activity about performing a laboratory test.</items>
          <items id="text">Laboratory test tracker</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0001">
          <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
          <items id="text">Tree</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0002">
          <items id="description">Pathology test is planned.</items>
          <items id="text">Test planned</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0003">
          <items id="description">Pathology test has been requested.</items>
          <items id="text">Test requested</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0004">
          <items id="description">Appoinment for pathology test has been made.</items>
          <items id="text">Appointment scheduled</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0005">
          <items id="description">Appointment for pathology test has been rescheduled.</items>
          <items id="text">Appointment rescheduled</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0007">
          <items id="description">The pathology test has been performed and all associated activities completed.</items>
          <items id="text">Test complete</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0008">
          <items id="description">The pathology test has been performed but related activities not completed.</items>
          <items id="text">Test performed</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0009">
          <items id="description">The pathology test has been postponed.</items>
          <items id="text">Test postponed</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0010">
          <items id="description">The pathology test has been suspended.</items>
          <items id="text">Test suspended</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0011">
          <items id="description">The planned pathology test has been cancelled prior to commencement.</items>
          <items id="text">Test cancelled</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0012">
          <items id="description">The pathology test has been aborted.</items>
          <items id="text">Test aborted</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0014">
          <items id="description">The pathology test was commenced but not completed successfully.</items>
          <items id="text">Failed attempt</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0015">
          <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
          <items id="text">Tree</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0016">
          <items id="description">The start date and/or time for the test. This will indicate the scheduled date/time when recorded against the 'Appointment scheduled' care pathway step or the actual Start date/time in the 'Test performed' step.</items>
          <items id="text">Start date/time</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0017">
          <items id="description">The name of the laboratory test (to be) performed. Coding of the specific test with a terminology is preferred, where possible.</items>
          <items id="text">Test name</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0018">
          <items id="description">Narrative description about the activity or care pathway step for the identified test, for example description about the performance and findings from the test, the failed attempt or the cancellation of the test.</items>
          <items id="text">Description</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0019">
          <items id="description">Reason that the activity or care pathway step for the identified test was carried out, for example, the reason for the cancellation or suspension of the test.</items>
          <items id="text">Reason</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0020">
          <items id="description">Additional narrative about the activity or care pathway step not captured in other fields.</items>
          <items id="text">Comment</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0021">
          <items id="description">Structured information about the test. Use to capture detailed, structured information about method & technique etc.</items>
          <items id="text">Test procedure</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0022">
          <items id="description">Structured information about the specimen on which the test was conducted.</items>
          <items id="text">Specimen detail</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0023">
          <items id="comment">For example: Local hospital departmental infomation or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.</items>
          <items id="description">Additional information required to capture local context or to align with other reference models/formalisms.</items>
          <items id="text">Extension</items>
        </term_definitions>
      </children>

            <archetype_id>
              <value>openEHR-EHR-INSTRUCTION.request.v0</value>
            </archetype_id>
            <term_definitions code="at0000">
              <items id="comment">For example equipment request.</items>
              <items id="description">Request for a health-related service to be supplied by a healthcare provider or agency.</items>
              <items id="text">Service request</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0001">
              <items id="description">Description of the requested service.</items>
              <items id="text">Request</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0008">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">Tree</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0009">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">Tree</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0010">
              <items id="description">The local ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service. This is also referred to as Placer Order Identifier.</items>
              <items id="text">Requestor Identifier</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0011">
              <items id="description">The ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for service. This is also referred to as Filler Order Identifier.</items>
              <items id="text">Receiver identifier</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0040">
              <items id="comment">In practice, clinicians will often think in terms of ordering services as approximate timing, for example: review in 3 months, 6 months or 12 months. As clinical systems need more exact parameters to operate on, this '3 months' will usually be converted to an exact date 3 months from the date of recording and stored using this data element.</items>
              <items id="description">The date/time, or acceptable interval of date/time, for provision of the service.</items>
              <items id="text">Service due</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0062">
              <items id="comment">Coding of the 'Reason for request' with a coding system is desirable, if available.</items>
              <items id="description">A short phrase describing the reason for the request.</items>
              <items id="text">Reason for request</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0064">
              <items id="description">Narrative description about the reason for request.</items>
              <items id="text">Reason description</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0065">
              <items id="comment">For example a referral with the intent of having specialist care take over the care of the patient, or advice on how to proceed with an investigation or treatment. This data element allows multiple occurrences to enable multiple choice selection in user interface.</items>
              <items id="description">Description of the intent for the request.</items>
              <items id="text">Intent</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0068">
              <items id="comment">Specific definitions of emergency and urgent will vary between clinical contexts, clinical systems and the nature of the request itself, so have not be defined in this archetype. If explicit timing is required then the Service period should be clearly stated.</items>
              <items id="description">Urgency of the request for service.</items>
              <items id="text">Urgency</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0076">
              <items id="comment">Record as TRUE if additional information has been identified and will be forwarded when available. For example: pending test results.</items>
              <items id="description">Will supplementary information be following this request?</items>
              <items id="text">Information to follow?</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0078">
              <items id="description">Description of the supplementary information.</items>
              <items id="text">Information description</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0112">
              <items id="comment">For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.</items>
              <items id="description">Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.</items>
              <items id="text">Extension</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0116">
              <items id="description">Language, transport or other personal requirements to support the patient's attendance or participation in provision of the service.</items>
              <items id="text">Patient requirements</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0121">
              <items id="comment">Coding of the 'Service name' with a coding system is desirable, if available.</items>
              <items id="description">Identification of the service requested, by name.</items>
              <items id="text">Service name</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0127">
              <items id="description">The status of the request for service as indicated by the requester. 
Status is used to denote whether this is the initial request, or a follow-up request to change or provide supplementary information.</items>
              <items id="text">Request status</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0128">
              <items id="description">A list of person's or organisation who should receive copies of any communication.</items>
              <items id="text">Distribution list for response</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0132">
              <items id="comment">Example: CLUSTER archetype specifying complex timing requirements.</items>
              <items id="description">Additional detail about the service requested.</items>
              <items id="text">Specific details</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0135">
              <items id="description">Narrative description of the service requested.</items>
              <items id="text">Description</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0136">
              <items id="description">The request requires immediate attention.</items>
              <items id="text">Emergency</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0137">
              <items id="description">The request requires prioritised attention.</items>
              <items id="text">Urgent</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0138">
              <items id="description">The request does not require prioritised scheduling.</items>
              <items id="text">Routine</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0141">
              <items id="description">Details about the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service.</items>
              <items id="text">Requestor</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0142">
              <items id="description">Details about the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for service.</items>
              <items id="text">Receiver</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0144">
              <items id="comment">This date/time is the equivalent to the latest possible date for service delivery or to the date of expiry for this request. For example: a service may be required to be completed before another event, such as scheduled surgery.</items>
              <items id="description">The date/time that marks the conclusion of the valid period of time for delivery of this service.</items>
              <items id="text">Service period expiry</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0145">
              <items id="comment">This date/time is the equivalent to the earliest possible date for service delivery. For example: sometimes a certain amount of time must pass before a service can be performed, for example some procedures can only be performed once the patient has stopped taking medications for a specific amount of time.</items>
              <items id="description">The date/time that marks the beginning of the valid period of time for delivery of this service.</items>
              <items id="text">Service period start</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0147">
              <items id="comment">Record as TRUE to record explicity that the request has no expiry date.</items>
              <items id="description">The valid period for this request is open ended and has no date of expiry.</items>
              <items id="text">Indefinite?</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0148">
              <items id="comment">For example: hospital vs home care delivery.</items>
              <items id="description">Category of service requested.</items>
              <items id="text">Service type</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0149">
              <items id="description">Digital document, image, video or diagram as supporting information for the request.</items>
              <items id="text">Attachment</items>
            </term_definitions>
          </children>

request.description:
Implementation Notes

This call allows uploading openEHR operational templates prepared by the openEHR modelling tools.


Response Messages


201  Success.

400  Invalid content (unable to read opt) (TMPL-3602).

401  Unauthenticated - could not authenticate user (SYS-9401).

403  Forbidden - the user does not have the required permissions to execute this request (SYS-9403).

request.description:
Implementation Notes

This call allows uploading openEHR operational templates prepared by the openEHR modelling tools.


Response Messages


201  Success.

400  Invalid content (unable to read opt) (TMPL-3602).

401  Unauthenticated - could not authenticate user (SYS-9401).

403  Forbidden - the user does not have the required permissions to execute this request (SYS-9403).

            <archetype_id>
              <value>openEHR-EHR-INSTRUCTION.request.v0</value>
            </archetype_id>
            <term_definitions code="at0000">
              <items id="comment">For example equipment request.</items>
              <items id="description">Request for a health-related service to be supplied by a healthcare provider or agency.</items>
              <items id="text">Service request</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0001">
              <items id="description">Description of the requested service.</items>
              <items id="text">Request</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0008">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">Tree</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0009">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">Tree</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0010">
              <items id="description">The local ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service. This is also referred to as Placer Order Identifier.</items>
              <items id="text">Requestor Identifier</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0011">
              <items id="description">The ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for service. This is also referred to as Filler Order Identifier.</items>
              <items id="text">Receiver identifier</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0040">
              <items id="comment">In practice, clinicians will often think in terms of ordering services as approximate timing, for example: review in 3 months, 6 months or 12 months. As clinical systems need more exact parameters to operate on, this '3 months' will usually be converted to an exact date 3 months from the date of recording and stored using this data element.</items>
              <items id="description">The date/time, or acceptable interval of date/time, for provision of the service.</items>
              <items id="text">Service due</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0062">
              <items id="comment">Coding of the 'Reason for request' with a coding system is desirable, if available.</items>
              <items id="description">A short phrase describing the reason for the request.</items>
              <items id="text">Reason for request</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0064">
              <items id="description">Narrative description about the reason for request.</items>
              <items id="text">Reason description</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0065">
              <items id="comment">For example a referral with the intent of having specialist care take over the care of the patient, or advice on how to proceed with an investigation or treatment. This data element allows multiple occurrences to enable multiple choice selection in user interface.</items>
              <items id="description">Description of the intent for the request.</items>
              <items id="text">Intent</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0068">
              <items id="comment">Specific definitions of emergency and urgent will vary between clinical contexts, clinical systems and the nature of the request itself, so have not be defined in this archetype. If explicit timing is required then the Service period should be clearly stated.</items>
              <items id="description">Urgency of the request for service.</items>
              <items id="text">Urgency</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0076">
              <items id="comment">Record as TRUE if additional information has been identified and will be forwarded when available. For example: pending test results.</items>
              <items id="description">Will supplementary information be following this request?</items>
              <items id="text">Information to follow?</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0078">
              <items id="description">Description of the supplementary information.</items>
              <items id="text">Information description</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0112">
              <items id="comment">For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.</items>
              <items id="description">Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.</items>
              <items id="text">Extension</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0116">
              <items id="description">Language, transport or other personal requirements to support the patient's attendance or participation in provision of the service.</items>
              <items id="text">Patient requirements</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0121">
              <items id="comment">Coding of the 'Service name' with a coding system is desirable, if available.</items>
              <items id="description">Identification of the service requested, by name.</items>
              <items id="text">Service name</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0127">
              <items id="description">The status of the request for service as indicated by the requester. 
Status is used to denote whether this is the initial request, or a follow-up request to change or provide supplementary information.</items>
              <items id="text">Request status</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0128">
              <items id="description">A list of person's or organisation who should receive copies of any communication.</items>
              <items id="text">Distribution list for response</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0132">
              <items id="comment">Example: CLUSTER archetype specifying complex timing requirements.</items>
              <items id="description">Additional detail about the service requested.</items>
              <items id="text">Specific details</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0135">
              <items id="description">Narrative description of the service requested.</items>
              <items id="text">Description</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0136">
              <items id="description">The request requires immediate attention.</items>
              <items id="text">Emergency</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0137">
              <items id="description">The request requires prioritised attention.</items>
              <items id="text">Urgent</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0138">
              <items id="description">The request does not require prioritised scheduling.</items>
              <items id="text">Routine</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0141">
              <items id="description">Details about the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service.</items>
              <items id="text">Requestor</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0142">
              <items id="description">Details about the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for service.</items>
              <items id="text">Receiver</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0144">
              <items id="comment">This date/time is the equivalent to the latest possible date for service delivery or to the date of expiry for this request. For example: a service may be required to be completed before another event, such as scheduled surgery.</items>
              <items id="description">The date/time that marks the conclusion of the valid period of time for delivery of this service.</items>
              <items id="text">Service period expiry</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0145">
              <items id="comment">This date/time is the equivalent to the earliest possible date for service delivery. For example: sometimes a certain amount of time must pass before a service can be performed, for example some procedures can only be performed once the patient has stopped taking medications for a specific amount of time.</items>
              <items id="description">The date/time that marks the beginning of the valid period of time for delivery of this service.</items>
              <items id="text">Service period start</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0147">
              <items id="comment">Record as TRUE to record explicity that the request has no expiry date.</items>
              <items id="description">The valid period for this request is open ended and has no date of expiry.</items>
              <items id="text">Indefinite?</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0148">
              <items id="comment">For example: hospital vs home care delivery.</items>
              <items id="description">Category of service requested.</items>
              <items id="text">Service type</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0149">
              <items id="description">Digital document, image, video or diagram as supporting information for the request.</items>
              <items id="text">Attachment</items>
            </term_definitions>
          </children>
