            <term_definitions code="at0000">
              <items id="description">A general clinical activity carried out for the patient to receive a specified service, advice or care from an expert healthcare provider.</items>
              <items id="text">Service</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0001">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">Tree</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0002">
              <items id="description">Service request to healthcare provider is planned.</items>
              <items id="text">Service planned</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0003">
              <items id="description">Appointment for a healthcare provider service has been made.</items>
              <items id="text">Service scheduled</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0004">
              <items id="description">The healthcare provider has delivered the service.</items>
              <items id="text">Service delivered</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0005">
              <items id="description">All service activities have been completed.</items>
              <items id="text">Service activity complete</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0006">
              <items id="description">The referral has been ceased before the service has been completed.</items>
              <items id="text">Service abandoned</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0008">
              <items id="description">The planned service has been postponed.</items>
              <items id="text">Service postponed</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0009">
              <items id="description">The planned service has been cancelled prior to commencement.</items>
              <items id="text">Service cancelled</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0010">
              <items id="description">The service has been suspended without completion.</items>
              <items id="text">Service suspended</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0011">
              <items id="comment">Coding of the specific service name with a terminology is preferred, where possible.</items>
              <items id="description">Identification of the clinical service to be/being carried out.</items>
              <items id="text">Service name</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0012">
              <items id="comment">For example: the reason for the cancellation or suspension of the service.</items>
              <items id="description">Reason that the activity or care pathway step for the identified service was carried out.</items>
              <items id="text">Reason</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0013">
              <items id="description">Narrative description about the service, as appropriate for the pathway step.</items>
              <items id="text">Description</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0014">
              <items id="description">Type of service to be carried out or being carried out.</items>
              <items id="text">Service type</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0015">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">Tree</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0016">
              <items id="description">The local ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service. This is also referred to as Placer Order Identifier.</items>
              <items id="text">Requestor identifier</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0017">
              <items id="description">Details about the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service.</items>
              <items id="text">Requestor</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0018">
              <items id="description">The ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for referral. This is also referred to as Filler Order Identifier.</items>
              <items id="text">Receiver identifier</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0019">
              <items id="description">Details about the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for referral.</items>
              <items id="text">Receiver</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0021">
              <items id="comment">Only for use in association with the 'Service delivered' pathway step. For example: record that this is the 3rd physiotherapy appointment in a planned sequence.</items>
              <items id="description">The sequence of the specified clinical service.</items>
              <items id="text">Sequence</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0023">
              <items id="description">The referral has expired before the referral episode has been completed.</items>
              <items id="text">Service expired</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0025">
              <items id="comment">Only for use in association with the 'Service scheduled' pathway step.</items>
              <items id="description">The date and/or time on which the service is intended to be performed.</items>
              <items id="text">Scheduled date/time</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0026">
              <items id="description">Request for service sent.</items>
              <items id="text">Service request sent</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0027">
              <items id="comment">Use to capture detailed, structured information about specified aspects of the service.</items>
              <items id="description">Structured information about the service.</items>
              <items id="text">Service detail</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0028">
              <items id="description">Additional narrative about the activity or care pathway step not captured in other fields.</items>
              <items id="text">Comment</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0029">
              <items id="description">Mulitimedia representation of a performed service.</items>

            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0030">

              <items id="text">test</items>

request.description:
Implementation Notes

This call allows uploading openEHR operational templates prepared by the openEHR modelling tools.


Response Messages


201  Success.

400  Invalid content (unable to read opt) (TMPL-3602).

401  Unauthenticated - could not authenticate user (SYS-9401).

403  Forbidden - the user does not have the required permissions to execute this request (SYS-9403).

                            <archetype_id>
                              <value>openEHR-EHR-CLUSTER.medication_course_summary.v0</value>
                            </archetype_id>
                            <term_definitions code="at0000">
                              <items id="description">Overall summary of the medication course.</items>
                              <items id="text">Medication course summary</items>
                            </term_definitions>
                            <term_definitions code="at0001">
                              <items id="description">The overall status of this order.</items>
                              <items id="text">Course status</items>
                            </term_definitions>
                            <term_definitions code="at0002">
                              <items id="description">Key medication event dates.</items>
                              <items id="text">Key course dates</items>
                            </term_definitions>
                            <term_definitions code="at0003">
                              <items id="description">The data at which the medication course was first ordered or recommended.</items>
                              <items id="text">Date ordered/recommended</items>
                            </term_definitions>
                            <term_definitions code="at0004">
                              <items id="description">The date at which the medication was first issued. 'Issued' refers to the prescription 'token' electronic or paper which authorises supply of a medication.</items>
                              <items id="text">Date first prescription issued</items>
                            </term_definitions>
                            <term_definitions code="at0005">
                              <items id="description">The date at which the medication prescription was last issued. This refers to the prescription 'token' electronic or paper which authorises supply of a medication.</items>
                              <items id="text">Date last prescription issued</items>
                            </term_definitions>
                            <term_definitions code="at0006">
                              <items id="description">The date at which the medication was first authorised.For a repeat prescription, authorisation refers to the creation of the repeat prescription 'master' which is followed by the production of one or more prescription issues.</items>
                              <items id="text">Date first authorised</items>
                            </term_definitions>
                            <term_definitions code="at0007">
                              <items id="description">The data at which the medication was last authorised.The date at which the medication was first authorised.For a repeat prescription, authorisation refers to the creation of the repeat prescription 'master' which is followed by the production of one or more prescription issues. Authorisation is generally only given for a limited period or limited number of issues, after which re-authorisation is required.</items>
                              <items id="text">Date last authorised</items>
                            </term_definitions>
                            <term_definitions code="at0008">
                              <items id="description">The date at which the medicaton was first physically dispensed.</items>
                              <items id="text">Date first dispensed</items>
                            </term_definitions>
                            <term_definitions code="at0009">
                              <items id="description">The date at which the medication was last dispensed.</items>
                              <items id="text">Date last dispensed</items>
                            </term_definitions>
                            <term_definitions code="at0010">
                              <items id="description">The date at which the medication was first administered to the patient.</items>
                              <items id="text">Date first administered</items>
                            </term_definitions>
                            <term_definitions code="at0011">
                              <items id="description">The date at which the medication was last administered.</items>
                              <items id="text">Date last administered</items>
                            </term_definitions>
                            <term_definitions code="at0012">
                              <items id="description">The date at which the medication was discontinued.</items>
                              <items id="text">Date discontinued</items>
                            </term_definitions>
                            <term_definitions code="at0013">
                              <items id="description">The date at which the medication was authorised or re-authorised.</items>
                              <items id="text">Date authorised</items>
                            </term_definitions>
                            <term_definitions code="at0014">
                              <items id="description">The date at which a medication prescription was issued i.e the physical or electronic prescription token was created.</items>
                              <items id="text">Date prescription issued</items>
                            </term_definitions>
                            <term_definitions code="at0015">
                              <items id="description">The date at which a medication was dispensed.</items>
                              <items id="text">Date dispensed</items>
                            </term_definitions>
                            <term_definitions code="at0016">
                              <items id="description">The date at which a medication was administered.</items>
                              <items id="text">Date administered</items>
                            </term_definitions>
                            <term_definitions code="at0017">
                              <items id="description">The data at which administration of a medication was withheld or suspended.</items>
                              <items id="text">Date administration withheld</items>
                            </term_definitions>
                            <term_definitions code="at0018">
                              <items id="description">The date at which the medication order was reviewed.</items>
                              <items id="text">Date reviewed</items>
                            </term_definitions>
                            <term_definitions code="at0019">
                              <items id="description">The date at which the medication order was last reviewed.</items>
                              <items id="text">Date last reviewed</items>
                            </term_definitions>
                            <term_definitions code="at0020">
                              <items id="description">The date at which the medication instruction was modified.</items>
                              <items id="text">Date changed</items>
                            </term_definitions>
                            <term_definitions code="at0021">
                              <items id="description">This is an active medication.</items>
                              <items id="text">Active</items>
                            </term_definitions>
                            <term_definitions code="at0022">
                              <items id="description">This is a medication that has previously been issued, dispensed or administered but has now been discontinued.</items>
                              <items id="text">Stopped</items>
                            </term_definitions>
                            <term_definitions code="at0023">
                              <items id="description">A medication which was ordered or authorised but has been cancelled prior to being issued, dispensed or adiminstered.</items>
                              <items id="text">Never active</items>
                            </term_definitions>
                            <term_definitions code="at0024">
                              <items id="description">The medication course has been completed.</items>
                              <items id="text">Completed</items>
                            </term_definitions>
                            <term_definitions code="at0025">
                              <items id="description">This medication order has been superseded by another.</items>
                              <items id="text">Obsolete</items>
                            </term_definitions>
                            <term_definitions code="at0026">
                              <items id="description">Actions reuulting from the order are to be temporarily halted, but are expected to continue later. May also be called 'on-hold'.</items>
                              <items id="text">Suspended</items>
                            </term_definitions>
                            <term_definitions code="at0027">
                              <items id="description">The medication order has been made but further processes e.g. sign-off or verification are required before it becomes actionable.</items>
                              <items id="text">Draft</items>
                            </term_definitions>
                          </children>

                            </interval>
                          </cardinality>

            <archetype_id>
              <value>openEHR-EHR-INSTRUCTION.medication_order.v1</value>
            </archetype_id>
            <term_definitions code="at0000">
              <items id="description">An order for a medication, vaccine, nutritional product or other therapeutic item for an identified individual.</items>
              <items id="text">Medication order</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0001">
              <items id="description">Details of the requested order.</items>
              <items id="text">Order</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0002">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">Tree</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0004">
              <items id="comment">This data element allows for multiple occurrences to be defined more explicitly at run-time, if required.</items>
              <items id="description">Unique identifier for the medication order.</items>
              <items id="text">Order identifier</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0005">
              <items id="description">The amount and units of the medication, vaccine or other therapeutic good to be used or administered at one time.</items>
              <items id="text">Dose amount description</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0008">
              <items id="comment">For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.</items>
              <items id="description">Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.</items>
              <items id="text">Extension</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0009">
              <items id="comment">This narrative should normally subsume data captured in 'Dose amount', 'Dose timing' and any additional instructions for use. Where the medication dose directions are fully carried by the structured, computable dose directions, this element should carry the narrative equivalent, generally auto-generated. If it is not possible to represent the intended 'Dose direction' fully in computable form, partial representation is not recommended, and the directions should be only recorded in narrative form using this data element.</items>
              <items id="description">Complete narrative description about how the ordered item is to be used.</items>
              <items id="text">Overall directions description</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0011">
              <items id="comment">For example: 'Start if symptoms recur'. This is intended for a general pre-condition which should trigger the whole medication course to be started, and not for 'as required' administrations of an ongoing order.</items>
              <items id="description">A condition which, when met, requires the commencement of administration or use.</items>
              <items id="text">Order start criterion</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0012">
              <items id="description">The date and optional time to commence use of the ordered item.</items>
              <items id="text">Order start date/time</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0013">
              <items id="description">The date and optional time when it is planned to cease use of the ordered item.</items>
              <items id="text">Order stop date/time</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0016">
              <items id="comment">For example: 'Stop after symptoms disappear''.</items>
              <items id="description">A condition which, when met, requires the cessation of administration or use.</items>
              <items id="text">Order stop criterion</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0018">
              <items id="comment">For example: 'Angina'. Coding of the clinical indication with a terminology is preferred, where possible. This data element allows multiple occurrences. It is not intended to carry an indication for administrative authorisation purposes.</items>
              <items id="description">The clinical reason for use of the ordered item.</items>
              <items id="text">Clinical indication</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0044">
              <items id="comment">For example: precautions as 'take with food', 'Avoid grapefruit', 'Dissolve in water', 'store in a cool, dry place'. This data element allows multiple occurrences and should be coded with a reference terminology, where possible.</items>
              <items id="description">An additional instruction on how to use or store the ordered item.</items>
              <items id="text">Additional instruction</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0047">
              <items id="comment">Generally this is only used when passing information between legacy systems. For example: '10mg bd; 20mg n' as used by the NHS Dose syntax (in development).</items>
              <items id="description">A parsable, computable text representation of the directions.</items>
              <items id="text">Parsable directions</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0050">
              <items id="comment">For example: To record that the patient had been taking antibiotics 3 days prior to hospital admission, in the context of a 7 day course.</items>
              <items id="description">The time period during which the individual/patient has already been using the ordered item as a part of the intended whole order but prior to the issuance of this order.</items>
              <items id="text">Duration of order completed</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0051">
              <items id="comment">For example: 'up to 1gram per day'. This cluster allows multiple occurrences to enable representation of multiple maximum doses that apply to different time periods. Lifetime maximum dose should not be carried here as it refers to multiple orders over time.</items>
              <items id="description">Details about the maximum, cumulative dose allowed over a defined period for the ordered item.</items>
              <items id="text">Maximum dose</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0053">
              <items id="comment">Example: 24 hours.</items>
              <items id="description">The period of time during which the maximum dose is calculated.</items>
              <items id="text">Allowed period</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0060">
              <items id="comment">For example: To record that the patient has taken the two first antibiotic tablets of a three day course, prior to discharge from the hospital to a nursing home.</items>
              <items id="description">The number of administrations of the ordered item that have been completed, as part of the intended whole order but prior to the issuance of this order.</items>
              <items id="text">Administrations completed</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0062">
              <items id="description">Details about medication safety for the ordered item.</items>
              <items id="text">Medication safety</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0064">
              <items id="description">Confirmation by the prescriber that the normal dose or other safety limit has been overridden due to exceptional circumstances.</items>
              <items id="text">Exceptional safety override?</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0065">
              <items id="comment">This SLOT allows for local variation in the different jurisdictions regarding medication dispensing amount to be managed.</items>
              <items id="description">Details about the amount of the ordered item to be dispensed.</items>
              <items id="text">Dispense amount</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0069">
              <items id="comment">For example: details of repeat/refill supply. This SLOT allows for local variation in the different jurisdictions regarding medication authorisation and re-authorisation to be managed.</items>
              <items id="description">Details of authorisation of the ordered item, including supporting local self-administration, issue and endorsement policies.</items>
              <items id="text">Authorisation directions</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0070">
              <items id="comment">Depending on the prescribing context this field could be used for either generic- or product-based prescribing. This data field can be used to record tightly bound orders of different medications when they are prescribed as a single pack. It is strongly recommended that the 'Medication item' be coded with a terminology capable of triggering decision support, where possible. The extent of coding may vary from the simple name of the medication item through to structured details about the actual medication pack to be used. Free text entry should only be used if there is no appropriate terminology available.</items>
              <items id="description">Name of the medication, vaccine or other therapeutic/prescribable item being ordered.</items>
              <items id="text">Medication item</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0091">
              <items id="comment">For example: 'oral', 'intravenous', or 'topical'.
Coding of the route with a terminology is preferred, where possible. Multiple potential routes may be specified.</items>
              <items id="description">The route by which the ordered item is to be administered into the subject's body.</items>
              <items id="text">Route</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0092">
              <items id="comment">For example: 'left upper arm', 'intravenous catheter right hand'.
 Coding of the body site with a terminology is preferred, where possible.</items>
              <items id="description">Name of the site of administration of the ordered item.</items>
              <items id="text">Body site</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0093">
              <items id="description">Structured description of the site of administration of the ordered item.</items>
              <items id="text">Structured body site</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0094">
              <items id="comment">For example: ' via Z-track injection'; 'via nebuliser'. Coding of the method with a terminology is preferred, where possible.</items>
              <items id="description">The technique or device by which the ordered item is to be delivered.</items>
              <items id="text">Delivery method</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0095">
              <items id="description">Details of the medical device used to assist delivery of the ordered item.</items>
              <items id="text">Delivery device details</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0105">
              <items id="comment">For example: 'To reduce your blood pressure', 'To thin your blood'. This data element allows multiple occurrences and should be coded with a reference terminology, where possible. If required it is possible to use a LINK attribute to associate this element with, for example, the 'original diagnosis' in a separate Problem list composition but the indication should be explicitly recorded here, as the link target may change over time.</items>
              <items id="description">An additional instruction directed primarily at the individual/patient or carers.</items>
              <items id="text">Patient information</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0106">
              <items id="comment">Example: Detailed instructions for phased dispensing of opiates.</items>
              <items id="description">An additional instruction directed primarily at the person dispensing the ordered item.</items>
              <items id="text">Dispense instruction</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0107">
              <items id="comment">For example: 'Please check renal function in 2 weeks'. This data element allows multiple occurrences.</items>
              <items id="description">An additional instruction which gives advice on recommended or required monitoring of the ordered item.</items>
              <items id="text">Monitoring instruction</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0112">
              <items id="comment">Course summary may be required when transmitting medication information between systems or representing a FHIR Medication statement. For example: as part of a referral, emergency patient summary or discharge communication.</items>
              <items id="description">Summary information about use of the ordered item, such as current status or key dates, generally used in non-prescription contexts.</items>
              <items id="text">Order summary</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0113">
              <items id="description">Details about the whole medication order.</items>
              <items id="text">Order details</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0129">
              <items id="description">Directions about the dispensing of the ordered item.</items>
              <items id="text">Dispense directions</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0130">
              <items id="comment">For example: 1, 1.5, 0.125.</items>
              <items id="description">The maximum, cumulative amount of medication which should be administered within the allowed period. The unit for this amount is carried in Maximum amount unit.</items>
              <items id="text">Maximum amount</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0132">
              <items id="comment">In many jurisdictions, substitution of an ordered item as a generic form or with a different brand name, which has been determined as bioequivalent, is allowed at the point of dispense or supply. In other cases substitution is assumed and the clinician has to explicitly request non-substitution.</items>
              <items id="description">Permission for substitution with a bioequivalent item.</items>
              <items id="text">Substitution direction</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0139">
              <items id="comment">For example 'Urgent'. This is left to be templated or specialised according to local valuesets. Some jurisdictions allow instructions to dispense to be marked as 'urgent' so that the dispensary handles them quickly.</items>
              <items id="description">An indicator of the urgency with which the ordered item should be dispensed.</items>
              <items id="text">Priority</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0143">
              <items id="comment">Use this SLOT where the detailed description of the ordered item needs to be explicitly stated. For example: the form, strength, any diluents or mixture of ingredients.</items>
              <items id="description">Structured details about the overall preparation including strength, form and constituent substances.</items>
              <items id="text">Preparation details</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0146">
              <items id="comment">For example: 'tablet','mg'. Coding of the dose unit with a terminology is preferred, where possible.</items>
              <items id="description">The unit for the maximum amount allowed.</items>
              <items id="text">Maximum amount unit</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0148">
              <items id="comment">For example: 'pain relief'; 'palliative care'; 'low-dose prophylaxis'; 'rehydration'; 'nutritional infusion'.</items>
              <items id="description">The overall therapeutic intent of the ordered item.</items>
              <items id="text">Therapeutic intent</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0150">
              <items id="comment">The total daily dose records the expected effective dose, and thus support titration of an initial low dose towards the effective dose over a period of time. This is not itself the target dose or goal but the actual effective daily dose against that goal. In some circumstances the Total daily dose will be calcuable from computable directions, in others it may need to be manually entered.</items>
              <items id="description">Details about the total daily amount of the ordered item expected to be administered.</items>
              <items id="text">Total daily effective dose</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0151">
              <items id="comment">For example '20mg'.</items>
              <items id="description">The amount of ordered item which will be taken each day if administered as intended.</items>
              <items id="text">Total daily amount</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0152">
              <items id="comment">The dose units are normally scientific units such as mg, ml rather than 'tablets'.</items>
              <items id="description">The dose unit associated with the total daily amount.</items>
              <items id="text">Total daily amount unit</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0154">
              <items id="comment">For example 'Generic preparation not bio-equivalent'.</items>
              <items id="description">The reason why an ordered item should not be substituted at dispense.</items>
              <items id="text">Non-substitution reason</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0155">
              <items id="comment">May be used to control the time of dispensing of medications with potential for abuse. For example: benzodiazepines or analgesics.</items>
              <items id="description">The date from which the ordered item is permitted to be dispensed for the first time.</items>
              <items id="text">Dispensing start date</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0161">
              <items id="comment">In some jurisdictions, orders to dispense may have an expiry date after which the prescription may not be dispensed.</items>
              <items id="description">The date after which the ordered item is no longer valid to be legally dispensed.</items>
              <items id="text">Dispensing expiry date</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0162">
              <items id="comment">For example: 'Not responsive at maximum recommended dose. Critical situation.', 'Peniciilin is only valid treatment, likelihood of true penicillin allergy is low'.</items>
              <items id="description">The reason for a clinical safety or maximum dose override.</items>
              <items id="text">Override reason</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0165">
              <items id="comment">For example: 'Hypertension control', 'Target dose 20mg daily'. The description could be used to identify a name, phrase or paragraph about the purpose for recording total daily effective dose, commonly to allow to titration towards a specific target dose.
The goal or target dose might be recorded here or more commonly as part of a linked EVALUATION 'Goal' archetype.</items>
              <items id="description">Description of the reason for recording a total daily effective dose.</items>
              <items id="text">Purpose</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0166">
              <items id="description">Additional structured details about the ordered item not captured in other fields.</items>
              <items id="text">Additional details</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0167">
              <items id="description">Additional narrative about the medication order not captured in other fields.</items>
              <items id="text">Comment</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0168">
              <items id="description">Substitution of the medication with a bioequivalent medication is allowed.</items>
              <items id="text">Permitted</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0169">
              <items id="description">Substitution of the medication with a bioequivalent medication is not allowed.</items>
              <items id="text">Not permitted</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0170">
              <items id="comment">This SLOT allows for local variation in the different jurisdictions regarding medication dispensing.</items>
              <items id="description">Further details related to dispense directions.</items>
              <items id="text">Dispense details</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0171">
              <items id="comment">For example: 'Allergic to penicillin', 'Atenolol duplicated'.</items>
              <items id="description">A known or recognised safety issue which applies to this subject and the ordered item, such as an allergy, drug duplication warning or contraindication. This element is normally only recorded when this safety advice is overridden.</items>
              <items id="text">Overriden safety advice</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0173">
              <items id="comment">In some settings, it is common to split overall narrative directions into more specific segments of narrative. For example in hospital settings, it can be common to split the overall directions into 'Dose amount' and 'Dose timing', both as narrative text. These terms can be applied at template or run-time.</items>
              <items id="description">A narrative description of a specific part of overall directions.</items>
              <items id="text">Specific directions description</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0174">
              <items id="comment">For example: 'Adjusted for amputation'.</items>
              <items id="description">A description of the justification used to calculate a dose amount or administration rate where this is dependent on some other factor.</items>
              <items id="text">Dosage justification</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0177">
              <items id="description">Details of structured dose and timing directions.</items>
              <items id="text">Structured dose and timing directions</items>
            </term_definitions>
          </children>
          <cardinality>
            <is_ordered>false</is_ordered>
            <is_unique>false</is_unique>
            <interval>
              <lower_included>true</lower_included>
              <lower_unbounded>false</lower_unbounded>
              <upper_unbounded>true</upper_unbounded>
              <lower>0</lower>
            </interval>
          </cardinality>
        </attributes>
        <archetype_id>
          <value>openEHR-EHR-SECTION.medication_medical_devices_rcp.v1</value>
        </archetype_id>
        <term_definitions code="at0000">
          <items id="description">Medication and medical devices heading (AoMRC).</items>
          <items id="text">Medication and medical devices</items>
        </term_definitions>
      </children>
      <cardinality>
        <is_ordered>false</is_ordered>
        <is_unique>false</is_unique>
        <interval>
          <lower_included>true</lower_included>
          <lower_unbounded>false</lower_unbounded>
          <upper_unbounded>true</upper_unbounded>
          <lower>0</lower>
        </interval>
      </cardinality>
    </attributes>
    <archetype_id>
      <value>openEHR-EHR-COMPOSITION.medication_list.v0</value>
    </archetype_id>
    <template_id>
      <value>IDCR - Medication Statement List.v0</value>
    </template_id>
    <term_definitions code="at0000">
      <items id="description">A persistent and managed list of medications that are reasonably assumed to be taken by the individual and that may influence clinical decision-making and care provision.</items>
      <items id="text">Medication list</items>
    </term_definitions>
    <term_definitions code="at0005">
      <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
      <items id="text">Tree</items>
    </term_definitions>
  </definition>
</template>

request.description:
Implementation Notes

This call allows uploading openEHR operational templates prepared by the openEHR modelling tools.


Response Messages


201  Success.

400  Invalid content (unable to read opt) (TMPL-3602).

401  Unauthenticated - could not authenticate user (SYS-9401).

403  Forbidden - the user does not have the required permissions to execute this request (SYS-9403).

Resource Url

https://ehrscape.code-4-health.org/rest/v1/template/{templateId}/example
Parameters

Parameter  Value  Description  Parameter Type  Data Type
templateId
required
  The ID of the template to load.  path  string
defaultLanguage
optional
  The default language to generate the web template with.  query  string
languages
optional
  Other languages to include in the web template, separated by a comma.  query  string
format
optional

The format of JSON representation of the example composition to return. Default: FLAT.  query  enum
exampleFilter
optional

The type of example to produce - intended for input (sent to the server), output (received back from the server) etc.  query  enum
Try it out!
Implementation Notes

Returns an example of data values for a ThinkEhr web template.

This method will show all the web template paths that can be filled out in order to successfully save a composition in the web template format. It will do its best to generate legal exampledata values for those paths, taking into account the data type and validation constraints.

Two parameters control the output of this call. The format parameter controls whether the produced output will be the web template composition values in either the FLAT or the STRUCTURED (hierarchical) JSON format. The exampleFilter parameter controls whether the example will show the values as they would be submitted to the server (INPUT) or received from the server (OUTPUT), since the latter one is more detailed.

The two language parameters determine the languages that the web template will be generated with before its example values will be produced and returned. See the documentation for the {templateId} call for more information on web template languages.

Resource Url

https://ehrscape.code-4-health.org/rest/v1/template/{templateId}/example
Parameters

Parameter  Value  Description  Parameter Type  Data Type
templateId
required
  The ID of the template to load.  path  string
defaultLanguage
optional
  The default language to generate the web template with.  query  string
languages
optional
  Other languages to include in the web template, separated by a comma.  query  string
format
optional

The format of JSON representation of the example composition to return. Default: FLAT.  query  enum
exampleFilter
optional

The type of example to produce - intended for input (sent to the server), output (received back from the server) etc.  query  enum
Try it out!
Implementation Notes

Returns an example of data values for a ThinkEhr web template.

This method will show all the web template paths that can be filled out in order to successfully save a composition in the web template format. It will do its best to generate legal exampledata values for those paths, taking into account the data type and validation constraints.

Two parameters control the output of this call. The format parameter controls whether the produced output will be the web template composition values in either the FLAT or the STRUCTURED (hierarchical) JSON format. The exampleFilter parameter controls whether the example will show the values as they would be submitted to the server (INPUT) or received from the server (OUTPUT), since the latter one is more detailed.

The two language parameters determine the languages that the web template will be generated with before its example values will be produced and returned. See the documentation for the {templateId} call for more information on web template languages.

        <term_definitions code="at0000">
          <items id="description">Height, or body length, is measured from crown of head to sole of foot.  Height is measured with the individual in a standing position and body length in a recumbent position.</items>
          <items id="text">Height/Length</items>
        </term_definitions>

        <term_definitions code="at0004">

        <term_definitions code="at0014">

        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0016">
          <items id="description">Height is measured standing on both feet with weight distributed evenly, heels together and both buttocks and heels in contact with a vertical back board.</items>
          <items id="text">Standing</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0018">
          <items id="description">Comment about the measurement of body height/length.</items>
          <items id="text">Comment</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0019">
          <items id="description">Record any issues or factors that may impact on the measurement of body height/length eg noting of amputation.</items>

        <term_definitions code="at0020">

Implementation Notes

This call allows uploading openEHR operational templates prepared by the openEHR modelling tools.


Response Messages


201  Success.

400  Invalid content (unable to read opt) (TMPL-3602).

401  Unauthenticated - could not authenticate user (SYS-9401).

403  Forbidden - the user does not have the required permissions to execute this request (SYS-9403).

                    <items id="description">Description of the device used to measure height or body length.</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0016">
                    <items id="text">Standing</items>
                    <items id="description">Height is measured standing on both feet with weight distributed evenly, heels together and both buttocks and heels in contact with a vertical back board.</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0020">
                    <items id="text">Lying</items>
                    <items id="description">Length is measured in a fully extended, recumbent position with the pelvis flat, legs extended and feet flexed.</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0000">
                    <items id="text">Height/Length</items>
                    <items id="description">Height, or body length, is measured from crown of head to sole of foot.  Height is measured with the individual in a standing position and body length in a recumbent position.</items>
                </term_definitions>

                <term_definitions code="at0004">

                </term_definitions>

                    <items id="description">Additional information required to capture local context or to align with other reference models/formalisms.</items>
                    <items id="comment">For example: Local hospital departmental infomation or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0000">
                    <items id="text">Head circumference</items>
                    <items id="description">The measurement of the distance around the head at the largest point.</items>
                    <items id="comment">The measurement is usually taken from above the ears and midway between the eyebrows and the hairline to the occipital prominence.
</items>
                </term_definitions>

                <term_definitions code="at0005">
                    <items id="text">Calculation age</items>
                    <items id="description">Age when measurement was calculated, possibly adjusted for pre-term delivery.May be expressed as a conventional age or as a decimal age.</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0010">
                    <items id="text">Percentile</items>
                    <items id="description">Percentile calculated using standard normal distribution for the given adjusted age.</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0011">
                    <items id="text">Z-score (SDS)</items>
                    <items id="description">The z-score of an observation for a given adjusted age.  The z-score indicates how many standard deviations the observation is above or below the population mean.</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0018">
                    <items id="text">Method</items>
                    <items id="description">The method or algorithm by which the calculation was derived.</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0019">
                    <items id="text">Comment</items>
                    <items id="description">A comment on an individual growth calculation.</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0020">
                    <items id="text">Height for age</items>
                    <items id="description">Calculations for height/length for a given age, adjusted for pre-term delivery.</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0021">
                    <items id="text">Sitting height for age</items>
                    <items id="description">Calculations for sitting height at a given age, adjusted for pre-term delivery.</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0022">
                    <items id="text">Leg length for age</items>
                    <items id="description">Calculations for subischial leg length at a given age, adjusted for pre-term delivery.</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0023">
                    <items id="text">Weight for age</items>
                    <items id="description">Calculations for weight at a given age, adjusted for pre-term delivery.</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0024">
                    <items id="text">Head circumference for age</items>
                    <items id="description">Calculations for head circumference at a given age, adjusted for pre-term delivery.</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0025">
                    <items id="text">Weight for height</items>
                    <items id="description">Calculations for weight at a given height/length.</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0026">
                    <items id="text">Systolic blood pressure for age and height</items>
                    <items id="description">Calculations for systolic blood pressure at a given age and height/length, adjusted for pre-term delivery.</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0027">
                    <items id="text">Diastolic blood pressure for age and height</items>
                    <items id="description">Calculations for diastolic blood pressure at a given age and height/length, adjusted for pre-term delivery.</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0028">
                    <items id="text">Overall comment</items>
                    <items id="description">A comment on child growth calculations, not captured in other fields.</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0029">
                    <items id="text">Body mass index for age</items>
                    <items id="description">Calculations for bofy mass index for a given age, adjusted for pre-term delivery.</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0030">
                    <items id="text">Adjusted for gestation</items>
                    <items id="description">True if the calculation age has been adjusted for pre-term gestation.</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0000">
                    <items id="text">Child growth calculation</items>
                    <items id="description">Calculations related to child growth, generally based on the subject's age.</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0001">
                    <items id="text">Event Series</items>
                    <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0002">
                    <items id="text">Any event</items>
                    <items id="description">Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0003">
                    <items id="text">Tree</items>
                    <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0014">
                    <items id="text">Head circumference for age</items>
                    <items id="description">The name of the growth calculation.</items>
                </term_definitions>

request.description:
Implementation Notes

This call allows uploading openEHR operational templates prepared by the openEHR modelling tools.


Response Messages


201  Success.

400  Invalid content (unable to read opt) (TMPL-3602).

401  Unauthenticated - could not authenticate user (SYS-9401).

403  Forbidden - the user does not have the required permissions to execute this request (SYS-9403).

        <archetype_id>

        <term_definitions code="at0000">
          <items id="description">A clinical activity carried out for screening, investigative, diagnostic, curative, therapeutic, evaluative or palliative purposes.</items>
          <items id="text">Procedure</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0001">
          <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
          <items id="text">Tree</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0002">
          <items id="comment">Coding of the specific procedure with a terminology is preferred, where possible.</items>
          <items id="description">Identification of the procedure by name.</items>
          <items id="text">Procedure name</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0003">
          <items id="comment">Use to capture detailed, structured information about anatomical location, method & technique, equipment used, devices implanted, results, findings etc.</items>
          <items id="description">Structured information about the procedure.</items>
          <items id="text">Procedure detail</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0004">
          <items id="description">The procedure to be undertaken is planned.</items>
          <items id="text">Procedure planned</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0005">
          <items id="description">Additional narrative about the activity or care pathway step not captured in other fields.</items>
          <items id="text">Comment</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0006">
          <items id="comment">Use this data element to record simple terms or precoordinated complications. If the requirements for recording complication are more complex then use of a specific CLUSTER archetype within the 'Procedure detail' SLOT in this archetype is advised and this data element becomes redundant. Examples: Hematuria after a kidney biopsy, tissue irritation after insertion of intravenous catheter.</items>
          <items id="description">Details about any complication arising from the procedure.</items>
          <items id="text">Complication</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0007">
          <items id="description">Request for procedure sent.</items>
          <items id="text">Procedure request sent</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0014">
          <items id="comment">For example: the reason for the cancellation or suspension of the procedure.</items>
          <items id="description">Reason that the activity or care pathway step for the identified procedure was carried out.</items>
          <items id="text">Reason</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0034">
          <items id="comment">(Was: The procedure to be undertaken is planned.)</items>
          <items id="description">This pathway step has been deprecated as it was incorrectly associated with 'initial' status - use the new 'Procedure planned' (at0004) pathway step  which is correctly associated with 'planned' status.</items>
          <items id="text">X - Procedure planned</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0035">
          <items id="comment">(Was: Request for procedure sent.)</items>
          <items id="description">This pathway step has been deprecated as it was incorrectly associated with 'initial' status - use the new 'Procedure request sent' (at0007) pathway step  which is correctly associated with 'planned' status.</items>
          <items id="text">X - Procedure request sent</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0036">
          <items id="description">The procedure has been scheduled.</items>
          <items id="text">Procedure scheduled</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0038">
          <items id="description">The procedure has been postponed.</items>
          <items id="text">Procedure postponed</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0039">
          <items id="description">The planned procedure has been cancelled prior to commencement.</items>
          <items id="text">Procedure cancelled</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0040">
          <items id="description">The procedure has been suspended.</items>
          <items id="text">Procedure suspended</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0041">
          <items id="description">The procedure has been aborted.</items>
          <items id="text">Procedure aborted</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0043">
          <items id="description">The procedure has been performed and all associated clinical activities completed.</items>
          <items id="text">Procedure completed</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0047">
          <items id="description">The procedure, or subprocedure in a multicomponent procedure, has been performed.</items>
          <items id="text">Procedure performed</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0048">
          <items id="comment">Coding with a terminology is preferred, where possible.</items>
          <items id="description">Outcome of procedure performed.</items>
          <items id="text">Outcome</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0049">
          <items id="comment">For example: description about the performance and findings from the the procedure, the aborted attempt or the cancellation of the procedure.</items>
          <items id="description">Narrative description about the procedure, as appropriate for the pathway step.</items>
          <items id="text">Description</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0053">
          <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
          <items id="text">Tree</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0054">
          <items id="comment">This is equivalent to Placer Order Number in HL7 v2 specifications.</items>
          <items id="description">The local ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service.</items>
          <items id="text">Requestor order identifier</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0055">
          <items id="description">Details about the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service.</items>
          <items id="text">Requestor</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0056">
          <items id="comment">This is equivalent to Filler Order Number in HL7 v2 specifications.</items>
          <items id="description">The ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for service. This is also referred to as Filler Order Identifier.</items>
          <items id="text">Receiver order identifier</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0057">
          <items id="description">Details about the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for service.</items>
          <items id="text">Receiver</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0058">
          <items id="comment">Coding with a terminology is preferred, where possible.</items>
          <items id="description">Urgency of the procedure.</items>
          <items id="text">Urgency</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0060">
          <items id="comment">Only for use in association with the 'Procedure performed' pathway step, and in situations where the procedure is repeated on multiple occasions before being completed or there are multiple components to the whole procedure. This may be the same as the RM time attribute for the 'Procedure completed' pathway step.</items>
          <items id="description">The date and/or time when the entire procedure, or the last component of a multicomponent procedure, was finished.</items>
          <items id="text">Final end date/time</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0061">
          <items id="comment">Only for use in association with the 'Procedure completed' pathway steps.</items>
          <items id="description">The total amount of time taken to complete the procedure, which may include time spent during the active phase of the procedure plus time during which the procedure was suspended.</items>
          <items id="text">Total duration</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0062">
          <items id="description">Mulitimedia representation of a performed procedure.</items>
          <items id="text">Multimedia</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0063">
          <items id="comment">Occurrences for this data element are unbounded to allow for clinical scenarios such as removing multiple skin lesions in different places, but where all of the other attributes are identical. Use this data element to record simple terms or precoordinated anatomical locations. If the requirements for recording the anatomical location are determined at run-time by the application or require more complex modelling such as relative locations then use the CLUSTER.anatomical_location or CLUSTER.relative_location within the 'Procedure detail' SLOT in this archetype. If the anatomical location is included in the 'Procedure name' via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant.</items>
          <items id="description">Identification of the body site for the procedure.</items>
          <items id="text">Body site</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0064">
          <items id="comment">For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.</items>
          <items id="description">Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.</items>
          <items id="text">Extension</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0065">
          <items id="comment">Use this data element to record simple terms or a narrative description. If the requirements for recording the method require more complex modelling then this can be represented by additional archetypes within the 'Procedure detail' SLOT in this archetype. If the method is included in the 'Procedure name' via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant.</items>
          <items id="description">Identification of specific method or technique for the procedure.</items>
          <items id="text">Method</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0066">
          <items id="comment">Only for use in association with the 'Procedure scheduled' pathway step.</items>
          <items id="description">The date and/or time on which the procedure is intended to be performed.</items>
          <items id="text">Scheduled date/time</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0067">
          <items id="comment">This pragmatic data element may be used to support organisation within the user interface.</items>
          <items id="description">The type of procedure.</items>
          <items id="text">Procedure type</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0068">
          <items id="description">The procedure, or subprocedure in a multicomponent procedure, has been commenced.</items>
          <items id="text">Procedure commenced</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0069">
          <items id="comment">Examples: The patient was agitated, insufficient emptying of the stomach before gastroscopy, a tumour in the bile ducts made it impossible to pass the scope through.</items>
          <items id="description">Difficulties or issues encountered during performance of the procedure.</items>
          <items id="text">Procedural difficulty</items>
        </term_definitions>
      </children>

request.description:
Implementation Notes

This call allows uploading openEHR operational templates prepared by the openEHR modelling tools.


Response Messages


201  Success.

400  Invalid content (unable to read opt) (TMPL-3602).

401  Unauthenticated - could not authenticate user (SYS-9401).

403  Forbidden - the user does not have the required permissions to execute this request (SYS-9403).

item.name: Get example composition FLAT INPUT RIPPLE PROMS_1

request.description:
Resource Url

https://ehrscape.code-4-health.org/rest/v1/template/{templateId}/example
Parameters

Parameter  Value  Description  Parameter Type  Data Type
templateId
required
  The ID of the template to load.  path  string
defaultLanguage
optional
  The default language to generate the web template with.  query  string
languages
optional
  Other languages to include in the web template, separated by a comma.  query  string
format
optional

The format of JSON representation of the example composition to return. Default: FLAT.  query  enum
exampleFilter
optional

The type of example to produce - intended for input (sent to the server), output (received back from the server) etc.  query  enum
Try it out!
Implementation Notes

Returns an example of data values for a ThinkEhr web template.

This method will show all the web template paths that can be filled out in order to successfully save a composition in the web template format. It will do its best to generate legal exampledata values for those paths, taking into account the data type and validation constraints.

Two parameters control the output of this call. The format parameter controls whether the produced output will be the web template composition values in either the FLAT or the STRUCTURED (hierarchical) JSON format. The exampleFilter parameter controls whether the example will show the values as they would be submitted to the server (INPUT) or received from the server (OUTPUT), since the latter one is more detailed.

The two language parameters determine the languages that the web template will be generated with before its example values will be produced and returned. See the documentation for the {templateId} call for more information on web template languages.

This method will show all the web template paths that can be filled out in order to successfully save a composition in the web template format. It will do its best to generate legal exampledata values for those paths, taking into account the data type and validation constraints.

Two parameters control the output of this call. The format parameter controls whether the produced output will be the web template composition values in either the FLAT or the STRUCTURED (hierarchical) JSON format. The exampleFilter parameter controls whether the example will show the values as they would be submitted to the server (INPUT) or received from the server (OUTPUT), since the latter one is more detailed.

The two language parameters determine the languages that the web template will be generated with before its example values will be produced and returned. See the documentation for the {templateId} call for more information on web template languages.
